description: I order delivery all the time and they always are on time or early! Decent sushi, decent price. My neighborhood sushi place!
author: CK Y.

description:
ok i attach a photo of what i order can u see whats wrong with it? not that they put all my orders together they gave us a tiny bitty wasabi they gave us 2 soy sauce? like come on r u guys serious? for this order we get just that? so stingy!!!
we order door dash so we didn't have to go out because i have a new born baby, my parents cant drive i thought ordering will be convenient! if i knew that i had to remind them i would! now i have to dress up, get up and leave my baby and parents to get some soysauce! im so annoyed when restaurants being stingy with condiments! atleast match it up with the amount we order. also they gave us 1 chopsticks and no napkins!! 
2 star bcz sushi was ok! but im so freakng annoyed!
author: Prinxez L.

description:
Just got an epic case of food poisoning after eating a couple meals from here. Literally playing Russian roulette when you eat take out or go out to eat these days lol. WHEW this hurts. Guess the toilet will be my new best friend for the next hour thanks to yama sushi. 

Lesson learned. Cook for yourself. Take the time to go to the grocery and pick out the meat and veggies yourself. Wash your hands and dishes thoroughly to avoid getting yama sushied like me. Never again from here.
author: Mark O.

description:
Problem with restaurants nowadays is lack of attention to detail.  Asked for no sesame seeds in the rolls due to allergy, but they came chock full of sesame seeds.  I understand some places premix in, but good places make a fresh batch for us without cuz it's an allergy.
Plus these places need to get a lesson in forming the negiri rice.  Too dense and too big here, like too many places.
Now in our sesame black list.
author: Roni L.

description: I order from here off Grub Hub tonight and WOW! Terrible cold, chewy, soggy, mushy, smelly down right wrong! I spent $53 bucks on 3 plates of junk. And grub hub customer service, after the 3rd attempt to share, offered me a $15 coupon... not only was I not wanting or looking for anything but a " sorry we will pass thing feedback on" but $15.  .... lol come on...
author: Rob M.

description:
I use to order here every week for my at home days and the more I ordered, the food quality became lower.

The meat is old and the sushi isnt fresh

Be careful on what website you use to order (grub hub, postmates, eat24) they all have different prices ranging from $14-$17
author: Donnah A.

description: I ordered deliver last night of just two rolls (spicy tuna and CA handroll). The temperature of both was rather warm. The handroll has really good flavor but the seaweed was a bit weird texturally. Hard to eat. The spicy tuna was rather mushy and the ginger was fresh and the wasabi had that good sting.
author: Lexi N.

description:
Tempura here didn't have the things that are what I call a "waste" because it's things I really don't want to eat - let alone deep fried, like bell pepper and onion. 

This tempura did have a beautiful mix of things I LOVE like lotus root, Kabocha squash, sweet potato, and taro. 

The udon with tempura was delicious! 

The agedashi tofu was gross. It was too oily and the  breading fell off the tofu. 

So get the tempura udon and enjoy it while smugly thinking to yourself how smart you are for choosing a place that offers tempura with vegetables you actually want to eat. 

Each and every single piece!
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
We got the Alaska Roll, Red Dragon Roll, Stir Fry Chicken Udon, and Sizzling Oyster. 

The Alaska Roll was nice with fresh salmon and avocado. It's basic and cheap, only $5. The red dragon was meh because the tempura wasn't crunchy or hot. It seemed kind of stale. The stir fry chicken Udon was yummy. The bad thing was that the chicken didn't seem like fresh chicken. It seemed like chicken nugget kind of chicken, kind of processed. The sizzling oyster was yummy and cheap, only $2. It had cream cheese on top.

This place is owned by Chinese people. The food is pretty affordable and filling, but the quality may not be the best. For our visit here, it was the processed chicken and stale tempura that we didn't really like. Other than that, it was good and cheap. The service was good. They refilled our water.
author: Amanda L.

description: I love this place for the convenience and just something to fill me up when I'm lazy to cook.
author: Jray M.

description:
Ordered from Doordash from this place. We ordered a sun roll, fried oysters and a oyako donburi. They called us to let us know that they're out of uni for the sun roll so we ordered a volcano roll in replacement. When we got our order, we received everything BUT the volcano roll and there was an avocado roll with our order. We called this place back to let them know that we got the wrong order to get a refund of some sort and the person on the phone told us that "if we were ok with the avocado roll instead". WHO WOULD BE OK FOR PAYING $15 for SMALL AVOCADO ROLLS?! NO ONE. We insisted a refund but they asked for our number BECAUSE THEY CAN'T DEAL WITH THIS ISSUE RIGHT NOW. How the F are you gonna say that to a customer when YOU MESSED UP THE FIRST PLACE. They could've just said that they'll give us a refund but instead gave us attitude and dumb remarks.

Next time, y'all should at least ADMIT TO YOUR MISTAKES AND HELP US FIX THE PROBLEM OR EVEN HAVE A BETTER ATTITUDE WITH THESE ISSUES. P  

NEVER ORDERING OR EATING FROM HERE EVER AGAIN. 

besides their food is mediocre, not that great.
author: Kai D.

description: Decent sushi and delivered in under an hour! I really enjoyed the handroll and salmon sashimi!
author: Julianne O.

description: Highly recommend this hidden gem to any vegans/vegetarians in the area. The green gyoza is unlike anything I've ever had in my entire life, even my carnivorous friends agree it's the bomb. As well as their veggie dragon roll beats most of the overpriced/bland vegan sushi in San Francisco. Those are my two go-to's, and I highly suggest you order those if you're vegan, I promise it won't disappoint. I quite enjoy their hot sake's, too. They have a hint of sweetness. Love this place for being accommodating to my dietary needs, and their price-points, make it impossible to compete with.
author: Mary E.

description:
LOL some people are trippin. I honestly stopped Yelping cause someone's got somethin to say, and sometimes its just bizarre.  Stuff like, "THIS BUSINESS IS A LIAR! (I mean, who would call Grub Hub customer service, they would never help!)" or "THIS TERIYAKI IS SO BLAND" (Even tho I could add soy sauce to a Teri and it's the kick right there).  I'm here to break my silence! 

This place has been around for some time, and has been fairly consistent throughout the years. It's your neighborhood sushi joint. If you're looking for some fancy pants sushi, I wouldn't go here.  This place provides your above average Japanese-ish food.  (i.e. Kikis, Noriega Teriyaki) Yes, the plate take out box decreased in size from ridiculous XL to "normal", but the offering for the Bento IS STILL HUGE.  Before the change, you got a plate seriously weighing the size of a baby.  Today, it has decreased to the weight of a newborn. I'm cool with that. And mind you, one bento and a VIP roll split amongst 2 people is a decent sized meal.

This place is so consistent and legit in my book for what it is.  If you're gonna order or get take out, hell even eat there- reset your expectations.
author: Cat A.

description: Ordered delivery from eat 24. Food was pretty bad. Tasted like day old leftovers. I got the beef teriyaki bento with chicken karage and  mixed tempura. The chicken karate was mixed and fired in the same batter at the tempura. Which made it soggy. You couldn't tell the different between the actual tempura to the "karage". I also got the sushi and sashimi combo. Which was also pretty bad. Fish tasted old or has been out for a while. And since I spent over a certain amount had a coupon for a free crunch roll which also was not very good. I wouldn't order delivery from here again. And if the experience is the same as eating in the restaurant I would pass.
author: John C.

description:
I've seen this place around for so many years now and finally decided that I was going to actually try this place after driving past it everyday. I honestly feel like people expect too much out of this place, just because it's sushi they expect top notch. 

When I went it was quite empty, I was the only one there. I was seated quickly once I entered and it was not hard to get the servers attention here. She did give me hot tea when I asked for ice water but it's not a big deal, I mean everyone makes mistakes. 

The food took a bit of time to prepare, even though I was the only person there. I saw that there were also takeout orders.

I ordered a bento, with salmon teriyaki, California roll 6pc and sashimi 4 pc. The bento also comes with miso soup and salad and rice. I added a order of mushroom maki 6pcs and oshinka maki 6pcs. This totaled up to $21 excluding tips. Which honestly is a pretty good deal if you're just looking for some basic Japanese food to fill up on. I'm not gonna lie the miso soup is terrible, I was pretty concerned to why it had a sour taste. 

Overall, it's just a quick place to grab cheap basic stuff. I will totally come back again when I craving for some California rolls.
author: Deanna C.

description: Excellent sushi and excellent service for very good prices. My friend and I would definitely come back.
author: Paulii L.

description: This is the first establishment I've ever been to that I felt like the staff was a bit shy. We've all seen rude people in the customer service capacity but these people look to be genuinely timid about human interaction. Whatever. I don't really need to be entertained anyway. When I lived in San Francisco and when I go back this is my favorite sushi joint. Great and affordable rolls. They make an exquisite deep fried California roll. Like I said they're aren't much for a bunch of talking but sushi they can kick some ass on.
author: Herman T.

description: WOULD GIVE 0 STARS IF I COULD!!! I just received my delivery from this place. On Eat24, this place is highly rated, so I felt no need to be suspicious. I ordered the spicy tuna roll, the Alaska roll, the spicy salmon hand roll, spicy tuna hand roll, and rice. The food arrived very quickly, which was nice. However, when I opened it, I was immediately was greeted by the smell of rotten fish. The salmon hand roll was just two big hunks of raw fish with no seasoning or sauce, shoved inside old seaweed. I almost threw up from eating it, and I only took one bite. The spicy tuna roll was average. I've had much better in other places. The Alaska roll was terrible. It was covered in fish roe that was obviously well past its expiration date. Overall, the worst sushi I've ever had. Please spend your well earned money elsewhere and don't make the same mistake as me.
author: Jenny J.

description: I got the 3 piece box, but the size of the salmon teriyaki is a joke as seen in the photo. I did not get any napkins, the sauces was leaking in my bag and the rice was undercooked. I have been to the location before and proportions are different when you order I guess. I was disappointed in this overall experience.
author: Ashley S.

description:
For years this place was my number 1 sushi location, only because it is close to my home, otherwise I wouldn't go there. Yesterday I stopped by for a bite. The location was empty, but anyway somehow I waited 20 min for somebody to take my order, in the end I left hungry and upset. Shame. 
It's time to look for a new location.
author: John V.

description: First time to try out this place. Sushi was pretty good, fresh and great deal. But the Miso soup we order was disappointed, it tasted like water. Miso soup I have in general is more on the salty size but this place too light; lack of favorite.
author: Gung S.

description:
Yama Sushi was good when Jeff owned it but the new owners have no sense of cleanliness or freshness and is running the place down. Tonight was the last straw after trying to support our neighborhood business. There was a strong smell of mold on the food in  the delivery and it seems its on  the ginger, my wife and i were both chefs. This is the second time we encountered
 this  but for the last few years there has been a downside in how its been run. We seldom go to the restaurant as there is boxes of produce all over the place and outside the door they were drying fish on the sidewalk. Sad to say after years of its first opening we supported it but now will never order there again. Pity . Really needs new ownership.
author: noel f.

description:
Disclaimer: this review is coming from someone who's only ordered delivery... 5+ times. 

Delivery options in my part of SF are slim to none, so Yama Sushi has been a consistent go-to when it comes to delivery food. We've ordered numerous rolls before and haven't really been disappointed with them. With rolls, you get exactly what you ordered, right? Well, what we've found to be underwhelming were the donburi bowls. Each time we order, we get a bowl hoping that it'll be different, but it's still the same bland bowl stuffed to the brim with rice. 

If you're looking for something basic, you won't be disappointed with this place. It's a solid place with good rolls, but I don't recommend getting the donburi.
author: Melanie N.

description:
Poor service. Poor quality, Late on delivery. Missed an item in my order, refunded me with an attitude, then they called me back on my personal phone number after to attack and harass me and question me about the refund for the item they forgot! Terrible way to treat your ongoing customer! I've been supporting your business for years!  Not any longer!
I never leave poor reviews, the attitude from these people is horrible customer service. 
Japanese place run by Chinese people with an attitude.
author: Cherie F.

description:
My food came quick.
The food is good.
The location is a little odd but it's perfectly because there's no big crowd like the rest of the city.
Parking was easy to find.
Will visit again.
..................................
............
author: Pinky V.

description:
WORST. SUSHI. EVER. 

dried out rice. rotting fish.  i had to throw it out.

And SOGGY tempura! It's supposed to be crispy!
author: V J.

description: Ordered through uber eats and holy it's was soooooo good!! Best sushi I've had in a while and each roll crafted really well. Packed amazingly. The only reason it lacked another star is because the soda they sent was warm which was off putting but other than that I loved it.
author: Dora A.

description:
Ordered delivery, the katsu shrimp was pretty good and unagi tempura roll was passable, but the duck ramen was inedible - the duck was soggy and had an off taste, the vegetables were bland and overcooked (carrots, broccoli, and cabbage?!), the noodles were somehow even mushier than instant ramen left sitting in the soup for a few hours, and the broth was so thin and tasteless not even a liberal dose of salt and hosin sauce could save it. 

The miso soup was similarly awful, it tasted like they were trying to make too much soup with not enough ingredients and seasoning. This might be attractive in a time of famine but at this point instant miso soup out of a packet would be leaps and bounds above this swill. 

Ended up dumping both the ramen and miso soup after a few sips. If you're set on eating here I'd stick to the fried goods, it's pretty hard to mess that up. Then again, I'd have said the same about miso soup before today.
author: Sin L.

description:
Was craving sushi while being lazy in bed. Downloaded the grub hub app and ordered from here. I actually used to drive by this place all the time but never tried it. I ordered a bento and some rolls with the free crunchy roll coupon. 

The delivery came on time and was way too much food! Don't know what I was thinking. This happens every time I order delivery though. The free crunchy roll was the finest roll I had ever seen but whatever its free I cannot complain. Everything was honestly not bad for cheap delivery sushi. I had plenty leftover for dinner and my cousin had the rest of my rolls. 

Their menu pricing is kind of weird because if you order specific combos, it ends up being wayyyy cheaper than some other combos they have with the same items. Make sure to do some quick math to get the best deal. The bento box is the best deal for sure. I got it with california rolls, sashimi, and teriyaki salmon for $14.95. Will def order from them again but zero plans to ever dine in here.
author: Tiffany V.

description: I have order this restaurant 3 times in Grubhub. I don't hate it when I try it. I think is ok. But my friends and my sister are disagree me and blame to me why I choose this restaurant and the food is bad. This is the last time and totally disappointed me, because the salmon sashimi have something BLACK DOTS in the fish, I am mad that why they could serve the not fresh sashimi to customers. I worry about my health and I will never back.
author: Cecilia C.

description: The food looked old. This was a dragon roll and it looked so old  The avocado looked disgusting. It was brown. This is a restaurant, the sushi shouldn't look older than a grocery store sushi that's sitting there all day...
author: Bianca S.

description:
Ordered twice now within couple months. Good fairly tasty, sushi could e served a little more chilled. Will update after trying more or their roles. 

See included pic on hours. Very confusing what shows on Eat24.
author: A V.

description: Yama is a hidden gem! Not super fancy, but amazing food, amazing service, and amazing prices. If you want great quality sushi without the extravagant prices.... this is your restaurant. I come here at least once a week....can't get enough!
author: Allison C.

description:
I ordered for delivery, and ordered a salmon teriyaki with rice, salad, and miso soup. 

Once good arrived I was so excited to get my grub on, but with one bite of the salmon with rice, there was no flavor at at. No pepper, no salt, teriyaki sauce had no flavor at all and wasn't thick at all. I was so disappointed. 

I digested for a bit and was just constipated the whole time throughout the entire night. I will never order food from here again.
author: Anriella D.

description: They bumped the price up in the last month or two. My last order of Katsu Donburi was $9.95 which I thought was great, but now it is $13.95. 40% price increase is a little much I feel.
author: Mickey P.

description:
Thought we'd give this place a try since it was in the neighborhood...but not sure if we will be coming back. It's a small place in an odd residential location but very close to Ocean Ave. If you do decide to come here, order the sushi. Avoid the ramen. 

Again, do not order the ramen. This is far from what you'd expect when you order a bowl of ramen at a Japanese restaurant. The whole thing was pretty bad and looked like something I could make at home. I ordered the chashu ramen which came with four pieces of chashu and what looked like a vegetable mix from a frozen bag. Broccoli, cut up carrots, and lettuce. The soup tasted like it came from a box as well. There was very little flavor. 

The sushi however, wasn't as bad which is why I'm giving two stars instead of one. I tried the alaska roll and caterpillar roll and a couple pieces of nigiri. The prices weren't thaaat cheap either but relatively inexpensive. The caterpillar roll was basically a california roll with an avocado on top plus a little unagi in each piece. Cheap uni ($6.50 for two pieces) but quality not super fresh.
author: Christina G.

description:
I normally don't write reviews like this but I feel that this experience definitely warrants one. For one don't order from GrubHub and for two, DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY FROM THIS RESTAURANT. 

I placed my order at 7:15pm and get a confirmation that this will deliver at 8:15-8:25pm. 8:35pm comes and there is no food so I call this restaurant and they then tell me that the food will be arriving in 20-30 minutes because the driver just left with the food. Okay....30 minute passes and there is still no food. 

I then call GrubHub and the first customer service person leaves the conversation. I then have to call them and then they proceed to tell me that there is no driver attached to the order and the restaurant has closed.

Long story short: THIS BUSINESS IS A LIAR. DO NOT TRUST THEM. If they can lie about a delivery, what else will they lie about? Terrible. Never ordering from this place again.
author: Tiffany L.

description: This is my second time coming here. The first time I ordered California rolls and they put wasabi inside 2 of them. This is my second time coming to Yama and all I can say is this was not worth it. I always eat at different Japanese restaurants and their bento boxes contains more than Yama can ever provide, especially for their pricing.
author: Jdjddj X.

description: This is my second time coming to Yama Sushi. All I can say is the service is horrible and they put wasabi inside of my california rolls.
author: Hailey M.

description:
First off, this rating is mainly based on deliveries. The reason for my review is to share my story with their customer service rep, Grace, which I'll do at the end. Not too epic, but I'm very, very thankful. I never write reviews, so this is how thankful I am.

Food: So, let me start by saying how much I love their fried foods (the chicken karaage and gyoza are my ABSOLUTE favorite and as a picky eater, that must mean something)! Perfect texture, seasoning, sauces; overall, delicious. I've only had one bad experience, which was when they gave me reeeally old versions, aka not crispy and had a really fishy smell/taste.. So, order by delivery at your own risk. It's been about 90% good fried food via deliveries for me, though, so I'm up for the risk.

Moving onwards... Sushi? Unfortunately I'm not a fan AT ALL. I've eaten sushi almost all over CA, and this place disappoints me. The rolls are soooo tiny, and the taste is really old... Everything smells like old fish and tastes that way. The texture is also really chewy, so I stopped ordering their sushi after two tries... Noodles? Meh. No flavor. Rice dishes? No flavor. Vegetarian dishes? According to my brother, he loves it and goes here with his friends occasionally, so I'll say it's a thumbs up for you vegans/vegetarians out there. As for me...yeeeeah, the only thing I order is their fried foods lol.

Price: Really affordable and reasonable for what they give.

Customer Service: Here we go. The main reason for my review... It's a Friday before a holiday and unfortunately my order got horribly delayed, so I called the company. I spoke to Grace, who was very sweet and honest, and she told me it was very busy, so I told her I'd wait little longer. I ended up calling back after another hour and so of waiting (Seamleas said they closed an hour ago), and she apologized and realized they missed my order... Two people started chatting with her in Mandarin or Cantonese and they sounded like they didn't want to deal with me or something... After listening to their conversation, Grace was able to not only help me receive my order fresh with a free side dish, but also even delivered it to me herself! She even promised me a discount on my next order. At that moment I really wished I had cash on me because she deserves a reward for excellent customer service. I wrote a bad review about their food a month ago, but Grace made me really want to continue to order at Yama Sushi again. I hope they are treating her well! Thank you so much for your help, Grace!! :)
author: Abee S.

description:
The wonton soup was by far the best tasting American version I have had in a long time!!
Spicy Tuna roll was great. I couldn't find fault with the food at all.
One concern is, that the order did NOT have wasabi included only soy sauce packets.
author: Me Y.

description: Their Seafood ramen. No ramen toppings with majority house cabbage and miso soup packages. There were two old oyster muscles and 1 shrimp split in half. If I wanted ramen like this, I wouldve stayed home, open up a package of ramen, used whatever veggies from my fridge, then call it a calorie meal bc there was no satisfaction. Disappointment at its best
author: Daniel K.

description:
This is a ok restaurant but it could use some work because when I come in there are boxes on the ground and everything seems to be dirty, along with that a moth almost flew right into my soup!!
I also see that the fish they keep are not very fresh because they keep them in a weird fridge, also I see that some of the fish have already turned green. The wait times are pretty long as well i was alone when I came here one time and it took them almost 20 min but in the end it was worth the wait the chicken was nice and crispy and the portions are pretty generous despite the prices being pretty high .
author: Anson Z.

description: Do *NOT* order delivery from here. Repeat do NOT. Mussels were cold and super hard/chewy. Bento box was cold, the beef teriyaki had no flavor at all, barely any sauce, and it wasn't even cooked all the way. It was on the rare side. Ew. Sashimi was ok... but you can't really screw up sashimi... ugh
author: Genesis E.

description: avoid delivery, i repeat avoid delivery. my order took 2.5 hours. eff these clowns !!!!!!
author: John E.

description: The location is in an odd part of the city near s residential area with a modest store front. I almost missed it when walking there. There was only one other family dining, but this was at 430pm. However they were preparing several large to go orders. Service was quick, we got our food in 10-15 minutes after we ordered. The fish was fresh and reasonably priced. After eating and paying our tab, we hung out at the table for awhile and never felt rushed. The atmosphere was relaxing. All in all it was a good, simple, easy dining experience.
author: Gina F.

description:
This is the kind of place you need to be strategic about when you go and what you order. I once ordered sashimi from here and it took me almost a year to come back. But I had an oyaki udon here, got there early in the day, and I was surprised with a quite decent udon here. 

If you are coming here, don't order raw food. This is a small neighborhood joint, with affordable price. Choose wisely.
author: Chan P.

description: While the menu prices are very competitive, the customer service is lacking. After ordering my items online for delivery within 60-70 minutes, my order arrived close to 90 minutes. I wasn't pleased at all with how long it took for my food to arrive, especially since some of the items I ordered were cold. Overall, I was very disappointed as this was for a Mother's Day dinner meal. I highly doubt I'll be eating here ever again.
author: Robyn R.

description: I ordered a bento box and fried oysters. Everything was tasty and fresh. Definitely one of the best bento boxes I've had around the area.
author: Alane N.

description:
Ordered at 6:38PM on Grubhub for the first time. They got the order at 6:43PM, and then finally got it at 8:32PM. 
I ordered tempura and sushi rolls. Tempura is soggy and sad (kinda on my fault, but I really wanted tempura). Sushi is average, not mind blowing, but good enough to eat.
The Crunch Roll is kinda not worth it when you reach the minimum $25 because it's basically soggy at arrival. 
The driver followed my instructions of calling me first. He was friendly and didn't cause me any trouble. 
Overall a decent dinner for one who really wanted sushi. You're paying for cheap sushi, you're gonna get decent but delicious sushi.
Also guys, please give me some free napkins next time. :c
author: Shaymin N.

description:
I like to eat at home...
So it was eaten by delivery...
I could eat without having to wait for so long.
Honestly....
I do not know...    Others think....
My thoughts are...
I don't begrudge giving star for this store.
   [ Names and natures do often agree. ]

Literally....
Everything very good... 
I love this food....
Good luck!! And Thank U.
author: Jessica K.

description: The sashimi did not taste fresh and that's basically the only things my son and I really look forward to. They gave a great amount of soysauce so thank you. No napkins and we ordered 3 bento boxes. The food was pick up, they estimated 60-75 min, but the food was cold. Maybe call when it's ready? The soup was warm and tasty though. Sushi rolls were salty tasting. Overall won't order again unfortunately. Worth a shot.
author: Lilly C.

description: I hate to leave another bad review, but the food here was hands down the worst Japanese food I've ever had.  The only thing this place would be good for is reversing a bout of constipation.  You'll be flowing faster than the river Nile after a meal here.
author: Bryan D.

description: This the worst Japanese restaurants me and my friends ever experienced. We ordered UberEat for the meals but they are not as good as we expected and not worth to wait for an hour. The sushi is not fresh. Nothing is fresh, not even the wasabi and ginger which you can tell by the color. The roll is too oily which is disgusting to eat. The Tofo curry has too less curry which makes to meal too dry and not good. The miso soup taste just like water. The beef died udon is bad also.
author: Xianyi T.

description: I would not give this place any stars, but Yelp wouldn't allow. Please do not order from "Yama sushi" or eat there. Worst food and customer service ever. I ordered from grub hub through Yelp and put in my order for pickup asap because the system would not let me place the order for pick up btwn 6:30 -7pm. I received an email stating grubhub received my order and is now confirming my order for take out within 60-70 mins and to keep your phone handy we will be in touch if any issues. I never received a confirmation that my order is being processed or ready for pick up through the app, email or text. Since 70 mins had passed I decided to call the restaurant if they had gotten my order because I was ready to cancel and just eat out. When I called a guy picked up and said my order had been ready for more than 30 mins. I told them i never gotten email, text or any form of notification that my order is ready. I asked the guy if he can remake the food since I had order karaage, meat, and sashimi. The guy said no and told me I can microwave it. I told him I never got any notification or call from them that my order was ready. I even checked the app and made sure all my notifications were on and there was nothing. All this time I had been wondering if they gotten my order. He said it's not their responsibility as I ordered from grubhub, I should notify grubhub. So I called grubhub and grubhub spoke to the owner to see if they can remake my food or partial refund, however, the owner refused. Grubhub tried second attempt of negotiation and the only offer the owner gave was 10% off discount for next purchase. I declined as I was not going to go back ever again. So, grubhub gave me a $10 off  coupon for next purchase that's valid for 30 days.
author: Stanley L.

description: First and LAST time I will be ordering from them - I ordered a dragon and volcano roll only for it to taste and look like it was sitting out for an hour or more before being delivered. The avocado and unagi on the dragon roll were brown and grey (signs that the avocado was not fresh when it was prepared). The volcano roll had slimy substance all over - I couldn't finish my rolls because it was so bad. They were nice when delievered but the food is horrible. I am not sure why GrubHub gave them a 4.5 star rating. Please save your money and order sushi elsewhere.
author: Vee M.

description: I ordered the beef teriyaki, and the beef was so hard. I wasn't able to bite it, and the teriyaki sauce have no flavor.
author: Amy Z.

description: DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE! I ordered delivery from them off Eat24 and received my Alaskan roll. Very excited to eat it when I bit into the roll I crunched down on something hard and pulled this (in the photo) out of my mouth. A PIECE OF PLASTIC that says "sealed for your protection on it". This is completely careless and not to mention a health hazard. I could have choked! DO NOT EAT HERE! This plastic was in two out of the six rolls.
author: Leah N.

description: I called to make an order and the person who picked up the phone was really rude and hung up on me. This is not the way you treat a customer by any means. Really upset and unsatisfied with the service and definitely not going to order from there again.
author: Sherif D.

description: This place is always open at 3pm just like how it says it is on yelp. I come here at 3 and they turn me away and say to come back at 4. This is totally outrageous like omg
author: Anthony D.

description:
I know this neighborhood badly needs a sushi restaurant ... but, where do I start?!

Despite being Chinese owned, I thought the happy hour box priced at $6.95 is a good bargain (only from 1 to 5pm!).  The sushi?!  SKIP IT. Poorly cut fish, looks unappetizing and served warm!  WTH?!

The sushi makers don't wear hairnets and our server had waist length hair which wasn't tied back (she served my miso soup and her hair was grazing the serving tray! ewww) Granted she was really nice, I'll throw in an extra star but if I ever eat here again ... 

Oh wait. I won't.
author: Janice C.

description: Keep driving.  Most of the business here seems to be DoorDash.  If you sit down prepare for a random and poor service experience.  Food quality only average.
author: Brad R.

description:
I'm sorry to say that what used to be my favorite go to sushi spot will not be any longer. I used to order from here on a weekly basis but then took a little break from Yama. 

I came back today and it was not up to par with what I used to think it was. My water cup smelled like wet dog and I saw one of the servers not cover her mouth while coughing as she was scooping a bowl of miso soup. 

My boyfriend and I ordered our usual, California roll, Alaska roll, NY roll, and a bento box. The salmon inside of my Alaska roll looked like it was graying and was definitely not fresh. Everything else was just not good.  

Maybe we'll take another break from Yama sushi and come back to try another time. Until then, we'll stick to Sushi Raw on Taraval.
author: Samantha H.

description: Holy shiitake mushrooms this is literally the worst sushi I've ever eaten. Writing this review as I eat. Absolutely ZERO flavor to any of the sushi rolls. The dynamite roll tastes like playdoh. The potato croquette doesn't even keep it's shape. I've had been sushi from 711
author: Hay H.

description: My childhood sushi place around the corner. It's always good. But the prices have increased over the years, but I'm not really complaining.
author: Jacky C.

description: Food is pretty good and the price is great! :) they are super fast with delivery and the sushi seems to be pretty fresh. would definitely recommend
author: K W.

description: Whenever I want sushi for cheap I eat here. There delivering system is great, highly recommend.
author: Gracie B.

description: The sushi was pretty good.  We got one with macadamia nuts which was my favorite.  Prices were expensive as expect in the area, but the way they price is stupid.  If the rolls are always 50% off, just change the prices.  Also, the waitress were asked if we were military, which we were, and they informed us of the 10% discount.  We reminded them when we were getting the check but they forgot to add the discount.  Could just be a mistake by our waitress but also feels like false advertisement.  Didn't notice until we stepped out, so partially our bad, but it was difficult to tell as well since it says there was a huge discount (the 50% off for rolls) but we didn't bother going back in to resolve it since we do not plan to return there.
author: Betty L.

description: Ordered food over an hour and a half ago and when I called in because Yelp was too busy to find out what the hell was going on, the restaurant didn't seem to have any idea where my order was. When they finally found it, they said 15 more minutes. 2 hours for food I could have picked up! This was the worst order I have ever made and I'm second guessing my yelp right now....
author: Michelle B.

description: Eh, this sushi place is mediocre. The sushi rolls are so so. Crunch roll was not yummy. The soft shell crab had a lot of breading and overly fried. Made the roll less appetizing. Was not brave enough to try any of their sashimi
author: Ann L.

description: Food was mashed up, tastes terrible. Delivery was super late.
author: Ashib R.

description:
It's Sunday night.. 11PM and I haven't eaten dinner because of Yama screwing up me and my dads dinner plans. I would usually already be asleep by now because I have to be up early for work.. So at this point I am beyond HANGRY and annoyed.

We ordered around 8PM.. An hour and a half rolls by and our food still has not arrived. Our food finally gets here and we opened the boxes and noticed that the two bento boxes we ordered are completely wrong! It wasn't even close to what we had originally ordered. We called them and they agreed to have our orders fix and re delivered in about 30 minutes. It's already an hour and a half and no one has showed up. Way to screw your customers over. Never ordering food from here again! It's sad because their food isn't bad.. But DO NOT TELL ME YOURE GOING TO DELIVER ME MY CORRECT ORDER AND NEVER SHOW UP! That's just rude!

*AVOID AT ALL COSTS!* -_-
author: Tiff C.

description: EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK. I RARELY write reviews, but the seafood ramen I ate gave me wicked food poisoning! Sad thing was I was eating it as a hangover fix and it ended up making me so much worse!
author: Brittany T.

description: This place sucks! At first I thought it would be good and worth it but turned out the fish they are using is crappy and not tasty at all for all the other orders! Come on have some status or have a decent standard of food you are serving to all your coustemor.
author: Fnu Z.

description: My favorite sushi restaurant! I have never been in the restaurant, but I order food online from there almost every week. Delicious miso soup and great nigiri sushi. Delivery is NEVER LATE, usually even much EARLIER than expected. And it's really cool because they never make you wait and they will never let you die from hunger :) I love sushi and I'm so glad that I found such a good place. Sometimes I even get crunchyroll for free :) thank you so much, Yama Sushi
author: Amalia S.

description:
incredibly rude person who hung up the phone on me needs to learn people skills!!

avoid this place!

zero stars!
author: Emily L.

description: The food tasted good! But the weight of fried udon is not enough. It is just about a half of the udon I have eaten before.
author: Yu H.

description: I love the donburi bowls. They have really good food. They absolutely suck at delivering. It said 1 hour for delivery and I was ok with that I ordered at 12pm expecting my food at 1 which still would give me time to eat get dressed and go to work. At 1:30 I called he restaurant and asked where my order was and they told me I had to wait another 30 minutes when the driver left 20 minutes ago. I contacted Eat24 and asked them to reroute my order to my job. Still by 2:15 my order wasn't there. Right as I was about to call them again he walks in at 2:40 with my food. Asks me to sign and goes on his way. No sorry no thank you for waiting. I work in food I try not to complain but 2 hours and 40 minutes for cold food...last time I order from here
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Do not let the relatively low prices or any free crunchy roll with $25+ orders trick you, it just isn't worth it! I ordered delivery from here using GrubHub on a stormy and rainy Saturday night. Despite reading the less than stellar Yelp reviews, I went for it since the sushi craving was just too real and the free crunchy roll was pretty appealing haha. The sushi rolls I got (volcano and california roll), including the free crunchy roll (woot!), weren't bad, but then I got to the sashimi combo I got and omg, I don't think some of that fish was even edible. What was edible, maybe the tuna and the salmon, tasted a little weird already. But then I got to the yellowtail and there was a smell coming off it and the rest of the fish so I had to throw it away. 

If you want cheap sushi, MAYBE choose some of their sushi rolls but absolutely avoid anything raw. It's not worth it :,( I had to order sushi delivery again the next day to satisfy my sushi craving... 

One extra star though to the poor delivery man who had to brave the stormy weather to get me this sushi :)
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
It's ridiculous this place is still in business. The first time I tried their menu was a few years ago and I recall not being impressed whatsoever. A few months down the road, I decided to give them another try. Mind you, they are the only sushi option that delivers and is open during the day in the area. I do not have much choice if I opt for a lazy order-in day. Not shocked at all, when my food arrives, the fish looked and taste like it's been dead for a minute. I'm only a five minute WALK away, so there are no excuses.

Now, we've given them plenty of time to improve, hoping they'd improve, obviously I haven't moved anywhere yet since my last order with them in 2014.

I place my order online, then gave them a call just to check something today, the lady on the phone ever so rudely told me off asking "but you DO know we are closed for our lunch break right now, don't you? The website says we're closed. Are you sure you didn't see that? Are you SURE?"

I'm done. IF I HAD KNOWN YOU WERE CLOSED, I OBVIOUSLY WOULDN'T BE PLACING A FUCKIN ORDER AT YOUR SHIT HOLE EXCUSE OF A RESTAURANT. Normally if I'm having cravings or am really hungry, I can tolerate a little "I'm on my break and don't want to talk to you" attitude, but I've had it with this place. Not only is your food mediocre and a possible health hazard, your waitress is a total fuckin bitch. YOU DO NOT EVER TALK CONDESCENDINGLY TO CUSTOMERS. If I had been talking to you in person, I would've talked to your manager and got your ass cussed out REAL quick.

End rant.


If you can wait til 5PM for K's Kitchen on Monterey Blvd, go there instead. Yama needs to work on the quality of both their food AND staff, or they need to shut down.
author: Joyce Z.

description: They are no local sushi spot. The rainbow roll is "Oh" so.good. The seating is alright. Nothing bigger than a group of 4 if eating here. They have a 90s dated TV up in the corner of the left wall. The bathroom is nice. I always call in b my orders for pickup. I usually go here around lunch time. The katsu here is good as well. Get the bento box. That's a good time.
author: Robert F.

description:
This is my second time ordering from this place. The food is delivered way faster than expected. I loved how thick their slices of sashimi is. Their bento box is worth the price. 3 choices for $14.95. The miso soup actually arrives hot!

By the time I finished the bento, I stil have two rolls that I didn't even get to eat.
author: kevin y.

description: Ordered delivery from this place multiple times. Each time my order always gets here earlier than expected & is always the correct order. Would love to try this place in person sometime!
author: Danny C.

description: Where do I begin? I ordered from this restaurant using the grub hub app on my phone. Long story made short my wife and I slammed down ( food came late) our California, Philly and crunchy roll around 9pm. Around midnight we both woke up within minutes of each other vomiting and defecating uncontrollably. Not only did we get food poisoning from this restaurant, it was so bad that the symptoms lasted a week. Because we both were sick, it took us a day before we were able to get to a hospital. The whole experience has turned me off from sushi and I looooooved sushi. Everyone, don't order from here, trust me its not worth it.
author: Nykk B.

description:
We had this catered at work for lunch today. I made the mistake of having some salad with my first serving. Well, I wouldn't say it was a mistake since it was decent. But the nigiri was my favorite. I also got to try the various vegetable rolls which were crisp and fresh. Everyone was addicted to the baked rolls, but I was more in love with the nigiri sushi. We also had chicken with teriyaki sauce on the side. I'm kind of hoping there are leftovers somewhere in one of the refrigerators tomorrow so that I can eat them tomorrow morning! Didn't try the rice in the tray but that's just filler!

I don't know that I'll go out of my way to come back on my own. But this was better than the last place that we had sushi catered from!
author: Venna Q. T.

description:
I've been regularly ordering food from this location via Eat24, however yesterday I ordered food for my kids and forgot to leave a tip. The delivery person upon delivering food, demanded a tip from my daughter. She told him to leave immediately and not to harass her. An hour later I get an email from EAT24 with the following text:
"Hi Konstancia,
Thanks for placing an order with Yelp Eat24 from Yama Sushi. Your order number is: 14002-40610.
The restaurant informed us that you want to add a delivery tip of $3.15 to this order. How generous! We have made this adjustment to your bill. 
If you want to make an additional change, share feedback, or serenade us, contact us by live chat, email or phone - 24 hours a day, every day. 
We tried to leave you a voicemail but thought to hit up your email, too. Thanks for your help!
Buon appetito,"
WOW, what a big lie. I always tip everywhere I go, but lying to the employer and demanding money from my kid is TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE. Greedy and Unprofessional.
author: Konstancia M.

description: Favorite sushi spot in ingleside. Located in the quiet area, it's cozy and welcoming inside. Great variety, quality and speed.
author: Alena N.

description: We ordered through delivery and our meal didn't come with chopsticks or soy sauce. I can't live like this.
author: Donna H.

description:
Was craving some sushi/sashimi so decided to try and order take out from here. It was the closest to my house.

Apparently you only get the free roll if you order online. If you call it in... you don't get the free roll.

I ordered the 
sushi and sashimi (15 pcs)- it was so skimpy looking...so very sad...not that great tasting either.
one of the specialty rolls- i forgot which one but it was decent.
and i believe one more item...

but overall not a place we would order from again....it wasn't even "cheap".
I think we were quoted almost an hour wait for to go pickup~! crazy. i guess they get a good amount of grubhub orders.
author: Christine M.

description: Ordered delivery. Everything was just so bad or mediocre. I mean I'm not surprised. Very poor quality. Delivery didn't take long and my order was correct, but I can't even give 2 stars because the food was just pretty bad. Not authentic Japanese of course.
author: Stephanie W.

description: sushi was super good i had a dragon roll and i forgot the other, but my delivery guy kind of demanded tip in an odd way so i gave him about 20% LOL
author: Itzel A.

description: One word describes their food... OVERCOOKED!! Ordered two bento boxes, one with beef teriyaki and the other with chicken.  The beef was overcooked, dry, absolutely no flavor. The chicken was burnt. Also ordered some rolls. Was really looking forward to dig in to some good food... but was incredibly disappointed. Never ordering from this place again.
author: D G.

description:
I ordered food today from Yama Sushi, which I order from and physically go to, a lot -as you can see from my check-ins. I gave this place another try solely because of this adorable old delivery man and the family that runs this restaurant. As common courtesy, before the delivery came, I put my dogs downstairs. 

They were barking when the delivery man was near my house as all dogs do. The delivery man was refusing to come up my stairs to bring me the food I ordered and kept telling me to come outside of my house and down the stairs. I kept telling him I put my dogs downstairs and they wouldn't be going outside (I figured most delivery people are scared of my pitbulls). He kept telling me that I had to come outside and I refused. He finally came up the steps are giving me attitude and when I signed the signature piece he said "I only deliver to human beings." What's it that supposed to mean? Am I not a human being? I'm not even hungry anymore. I don't want this food anymore. 

I called the establishment and all the manager said was that they won't send me that particular driver ever again. So much for customer satisfaction. Guess my order was a wasted of $25 dollars, as I threw it out.

I am also upset with myself for adding a tip onto this order pre-delivery.
author: Shilo B.

description: Inexpensive and they deliver. Our Hamachi Kama was over salted and my udon had more of a Chinese taste than Japanese flavors. Our sashimi was fresh.
author: Julie L.

description: Such poor customer service it sadly makes their mediocre food not worth it.. I simply told them something I ordered wasn't there and I was called a liar multiple times. Luckily eat24 support is great at times like that. Pretty decent food but idk not gonna try it again
author: Kathy W.

description:
For the price, this is a stand-up place! I'm thinking some of the low stars are because people are expecting 5-star sushi at a 1-start price. Well, this isn't Ryoko. For what I paid, I still have lots to spare for shopping at CVS :)

The other things that I like:
-they serve their miso in little paper cups for take-out instead of plastic so not ingesting all sorts of BBPs !
-some good veggie options for non-meat eaters. I had a dish with pumpkin (!) and some other cool root veggies (is that Burdock?). Anyway, I'm sure it going to make me live three years longer
-It is a convenient neighborhood restaurant, I can walk to

Hoping to see what happens. If I were Yama, I would offer fewer choices and get really good at a few things. Don't let these reviews get you down - you rock!
author: Michelle S.

description: Ordered from Eat24.  Review based on delivery.  Got confirmation for delivery to arrive at 816pm.  Knock on the door was at 9pm.  Not going to go into details of my conversation with Eat24, but I will ask this...why would Yama Sushi deliver to South San Francisco if you can't guarantee actual delivery time?  If you think you can deliver all the way to SSF on time...then own it.  If you can't deliver on time then call the customer and say so.  Give the option to cancel order or for the customer to have a Scooby snack before food is delivered.  After reading the other reviews, I think this will be the last time I take a chance on Yama Sushi.
author: Yvette H.

description:
Thought I'd give this neighborhood sushi place a try, and ordered the bento box only to be left beyond disappointed. 

First, midway through the first bite of my katsu - I found a CURLY BLACK HAIR entangled with the meat.

Secondly, their sushi portions are TINY, their sashimi pieces are literally 2.5 inches long and 1 inch wide. 

Finally, getting small portions became a blessing in disguise since it tasted anything but fresh.

Never. Again.
author: Edna M.

description:
Damn it, I tried them again...  Take the chopsticks out of you ears and listen, Please, 4 chopsticks please.   Food was good, price is right, delivery time below par, but damn it people, listen and read what your customers ask for. 

I can drop a 2"x4" off in front of your store if would help you give me enough chopsticks for my family.

Sushi Ku, please start delivering, your much better.
author: ted s.

description:
So good! We had this catered to my office for lunch the other day and it was really good and fresh. I was surprise because usually catered sushi isn't that fresh, but it was. We also had a lot of roll choices, including spicy tuna, california rolls, eel, and veggie rolls. 

I had a bunch of sushi at 12:00, and then a few more rolls at 4:00, and they were still fresh and delicious at 4:00. I would definitely recommend this place if you want to order a lot of sushi.
author: Jenna G.

description: Have been ordering from Yama for delivery for several years now via Eat24 and have always had good service and good food, attention to detail, never missed an item and we order a lot of food. Occasionally waited longer for delivery to be made but never an issue and I feel for people making the delivery; it's a heck of a nice convenience. I've always had respect for people that work on in service industry, and many friends over the years, so I tip well.
author: Donald C.

description:
This is a little restaurant hidden in a quite neighborhood of the city. It won't wow you with the decor or the size of the establishment. The sushi selection is not bad but not great. 

Everything tasted fine and the waitress was friendly and attentive. 

This place is okay if you live in the area and don't feel like going far but nothing to write home about.
author: Russell G.

description: Chicken teriyaki bland. Fried shrimp over-breaded couldn't taste shrimp. Two wait staff on cell phones as I waited for more water. Japanese restaurant run by Chinese.
author: H L.

description:
Its weird here...
Came for the "Happy Hour" they advertise it from 1-5.
Tables sticky
Server was eating a couple tables next to me ...???
Menu is not appetizing 

I ordered Potstickers and dumplings (steamed) and a beer. Potstickers fine, but dumpling are like the ones u get at Traders, like tiny & weird. 
Ok but the weirdest part is the server looking over at me waiting to see when I was ready while eating her noodles ... Ewwwe, yucky 

Sorry neighborhood joint.
author: Tere C.

description:
The only good thing about this place is for being the only sushi restaurant in the area. 

They have decent bento box items but I'd stay away from their Nigiris and sushi rolls.

Not to have any prejudice or anything, but I can't help but notice that young kids are the ones that make their sushi. As I sit in the counter, I notice that they seem to just pile stuff in their rolls and seem to not take their time- unlike the usual artistry that I seem to notice sushi with.

It may just be a preference but, to each it's own, right? And just the fact that Chinese people run a Japanese restaurant is odd in my opinion... (Yeah that includes the Panda Express reference) lol
author: Jan R.

description: This sushi place is conveniently located about 10 minutes down the street from sfsu. It looks kind of run down from the outside but don't let that scare you! The volcano roll is so good here and the workers were all super nice and sushi came out quickly. We got the set 6 option, 40 pieces for $30. Definitely worth it. The shrimp didn't taste so fresh, but the eel and everything else was really good. Street parking is kind of hard to find, so that's a downside. Other than that, this is a place I would come for good sushi for a good price.
author: Maleah M.

description: Ordered delivery from here at 7:30pm. It is currently 9:20pm and no food. I've called twice. First time they say the foods ready they're waiting on the driver. 45 minutes later I call for a Second time, they say the food is on its way. Will update review when food gets here but so far it doesn't look like I will patronizing this establishment again.
author: Heilala F.

description:
Lol @ all the positive reviews for this place. I don't think this place should even exist anymore. I've always gotten my sushi delivered because driving by the place and seeing the lack of people gets me a little unsettled so sometimes I rather not remember that part when I order. I live over the hill (literally 2 minute drive from the place) so I don't expect the food to turn bad by the time it gets to my house. The miso soup was still boiling hot when I tried it so why can't the sushi be of same quality?

I just came back from a trip and wasn't in the mood to cook. Since I live in a neighborhood where there aren't many restaurants around to deliver in the first place, I was already limited in my options. I was feeling some sushi so i thought I'd just try Yama again since last time wasn't so bad.

Wrong.

The order was on time (how can you mess that up, I ordered before they even opened) and the driver was friendly. As soon as I opened up the sushi, I could already tell this wasn't going to go well. The artificial crab was nearly gray. I was straining my eyes to try to find the red specks as part of the crab but the whole thing looked bland. That was already a red flag. I took the first bite and it was hard to swallow. The rice was not soft, it was 2-day old rice at least. Very dry and stale. So California Roll was already a bust. I also ordered the Peacock Roll but that didn't go well either. The fish was so not fresh or even satisfyingly edible so I gave up. I wanted to finish my miso soup but once it cooled down that didn't taste as good either.

Yama lost another customer today. Why buy cheap seafood when you lose money from your customers anyway? Up your sushi game, Yama or you probably won't stick around for much longer.

OH & shoutout to Eat24 for refunding my whole order without any hassle. At least I know if I order through them, my money isn't completely lost if things go awry.
author: Cathy N.

description: One of my favorite sushi spots to come to in SF. (I found this place because it was near my yoga studio.) Anyhow, the sushi is always awesome and never disappoints. They also have cold sake available for the same price as hot sake. Most places don't have cold sake for the price they charge here. I'm texture person and I like how this sushi is. Everything from how the seaweed is, the rice, the fish, it passes my preference. Like it's fresh yo. Not that chewy soggy ish. Fo shizzle. The staff is nice too. Anyways, there's nothing to complain about with this place. If I say it's good then it's good. Word. Tastes good here me love you long time. Good sushi after yoga or jiu jitsu. Ok my sake is kicking in. Bye time to eat.
author: Angela O.

description: DONT order from them. We ordered from EAT24 and it took 2 and a half hours to get our sushi. After an hour and half, when we called them to check the status, the manager yelled at us and told us she's "busy and would be happy to cancel our order". We said we weren't calling to cancel, just wanted to know when to expect the food. VERY RUDE.
author: Desiree S.

description: The Sushi was good but having to wait 93 minutes for the food I think its not ok, my wife had to cook something on the fly to my hungry kids :-(
author: Oscar H.

description:
Came here on weekday,  9pm. Not crowded.  Was a little worried cuz mom used to say if nobody in a restaurant then you shouldn't eat there. Mom's right! Ordered check board roll even the waitress repeated it,  took a bite of it - inside spicy tuna.  I'm glad I was not allergic to spicy! Funny thing is nobody was in the restaurant so how can you screw up? Side note everyone spoke Chinese there.  Women didn't even apologize for giving me the wrong roll she just laughed... Sigh. Not / never going to be back & telling my friends not to go there... BEWARE

Update - after 1/2 -1 hr my stomach started to make weird noises...Do Not Come Here!
author: Thomas C.

description: I had originally written a great review of this place. I don't know what happened but they have gone so downhill. I was a customer for many years. Tonight I ordered delivery and had ordered some uni nigiri in addition to other items. When I opened the bag, I'd been given unagi nigiri instead. There's a difference in both what these things are and price as well. So I immediately called the restaurant. I tried to explain what happened and then was put on hold for two minutes. Then I had to repeat myself about three times about what happened. It's not the first time or even second time I've gotten wrong things from them but have let it go in the past. Third's a charm. The woman on the phone told me the manager would refund my credit card. I said "fine". About an hour and a half later they called me back and accused me of lying about the order. Who does that? They argued with me that I had really gotten it! And that I was making it up! It was a real wtf moment. I told them that if they wanted to lose my business over some uni that they were welcome to do so. But that they were the ones making things up. She actually yelled at me. Then also in a very angry tone said that they'd credit me for it. That remains to be seen. But it doesn't matter,  I won't be back there anytime soon. It's too cray-cray for me! And now there are other good sushi places that deliver. Obviously, they do not need my business.
author: Debbie B.

description:
I can truly say I enjoy having Yama Sushi around the corner.
Anyone who thinks this place is going to be some sort of exotic sushi bar with types of fish that you don't even know the name to, is ridiculously mistaken and you need to take your business elsewhere.

To start, I don't normally order sashimi or even nigiri from Yama sushi. I am a sushi snob that usually only orders sashimi and nigiri, if I was in a much higher end sushi restaurant.

Yama is for ordering quick take-out/delivery rolls and bento boxes. You can even sit there (especially during Happy Hour specials!) and enjoy a Kirin and slowly pass your time by with meh-tasting sushi rolls. It's what they're for!

The SO lives walking distance from here so we decided to partake in their happy hour. Meh, it's just ok. It's nice though to be in a pretty quiet, nearly empty restaurant to relax and eat a little bit. After a small discussion, we decided not to waste our money on nigiri and sashimi, that can be for days we're at a nice sushi restaurant.

Instead we spent our money on Kirin, a Black and White roll (Tofu and Eel, deep fried), rock and roll, Saba Shioyaki/Beef Teriyaki Bento and Baked Mussels.

We paid Happy Hour prices, which made everything decent. The BW roll barely had any eel. Saba/Beef and Rock n Roll, normal fare. The bento boxes are not bad for $9 at all (Come on this is still SF!)! Baked mussels, do not bother ordering these. MEH. A kirin, sapporo and hot sake. Our total was still under $40.

Not too shabby! So again, don't order sashimi/nigiri, don't bother with anything that is super exotic or difficult to make. Save all of that money for a nice high-end sushi restaurant and you will enjoy having it much more. Bento boxes, easy to make rolls and cooked food items. Sure. Why not?

Enjoy!
author: Winè C.

description:
So upset this place doesn't even get 1 star !! I ordered off of grub hub and I'm writing this as I wait now for almost 3 hours . I cannot believe this then when the food
For here it was so cold and all the tempura is soggy I will never order from this place again first and last time !! Please do not waist your time my children have waited to long to eat comparing how hungry they are now so upset never again
author: Deziree P.

description: Very affordable, not expensive at all. There Bento Box is a great deal and I love there Katsu. I've eaten here and had delivery, and have never been disappointed.
author: Frank R.

description: I ordered delivery. The guy couldn't find me because he went to the wrong parking lot. I told him directions and he became flustered,  his English wasn't very good.  When he did find the main office he refused to give me my meal unless I gave him a tip. All I had was $5, and I didn't want to give that to him because, he was rude and it would have been a 25% tip which he doesn't deserve.  I wanted change back but he wouldn't give it to me.  He's a jerk and the warm food was cold by the time it got to me.
author: Gin S.

description: Great little neighborhood spot for food and drink. I've never been disappointed by anything here, and they are quick to deliver. My usual order is: Veggie Dragon & Avocado Rolls, super tasty!
author: Sarah D.

description:
I had delivery from Yama the other day and I'm ordering again!
There's not much to say about their sushi as I didn't exactly try it but I had the Tonkatsu Donburi and the Yama Curry Chicken Katsu which were a couple steps above average. I didn't expect to get really delicious food from delivery but I loved it. It came with a free Crunchy Roll which was 4 or 6 small pieces of deep fried California? roll. 
Donburi isn't usually a dish anybody raves about because its about the same everywhere but Yama's is just really good.
author: Leon Z.

description: I failed to read the reviews - BEWARE  do not order within an hour of closing time - they will not only take your order and money but will not deliver or have the courtesy of calling you to tell you that they wont. Good luck staying in business..
author: Felipe M.

description: This sushi place is a cute little corner restaurant that you can really miss if you're not paying attention.  The service was fast and friendly and the food wasn't too bad either.  Good pricing for good food.  Definitely coming back to try some more.
author: Christina M.

description:
If I could give these people negative 20 stars, I would. They should be cited for fraud, for passing this stuff off as food. 
I ordered 5 Bento boxes via Door Dash. When my food arrived (ON TIME), the containers were soggy, the food was lukewarm, and I was short one Bento box. I called the restaurant, and the lady admitted she only made 4, but refused to deliver the 5th box. She suggested I call DoorDash and they would take care of it in a couple days. After 20 minutes of arguing, and playing stupid, she agreed to deliver the food...in an hour...because she was too busy....
After taking a bite of the food, I can say the tuna sashimi is pre frozen. Fish is not supposed to separate if it is fresh. 
Also, the delivery driver nearly got into a fight with me because I refused to tip him, after he delivered the rest of the food...an hour and a half later....
author: A. C.

description: Happy hour is good for drinks nuts lip the food and the girl who works the front and tables isn't attentive at all. Also their signs are so funny "happy hour from 2-5 everyday" however they are closed from 3-4:30? strange...
author: Jeanne R.

description: This is the worst sushi restaurant I've been to. Came here cuz they had an happy hour menu, when we got there, they said they don't have that and pointed to the "happy lunch box" instead. I ordered a bento box with "CA roll, Chicken katsu and BBQ eel." The crust on the chicken was falling off, the chicken itself was chewy like rubber. That texture was gross. The BBQ eel turns out to be 2 pieces of unagi nigiri, wtf!? That's false advertising? My girlfriend ordered 3 sushi rolls, the baked scallop roll tasted like old fish and smelled bad. The ca roll was super small and stuffed with rice. The eel skin roll had barely any eel. Avoid this place, trust me. I've had gas station sushi better than this. There's certain tricks cheap sushi restaurants deploy, like stuffing rolls with more rice, using cheaper fish, etc. This restaurant used all those tricks and more. DO NOT trust the pictures you see here, notice they're all at least a year old or more. The food looks nowhere near this good. This place does not deserve a 3 star rating.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Ordered delivery...sushi even the most basic avo roll was dry and flavorless. Cost 24 bux and def was not worth it. Delivery guy was blah too...Will not order from here again
author: Onyi O.

description:
GAH! If there is one thing I cannot stand is finding hair in my food. The second would be bringing me the wrong order -_-

Our entire office will order from here quite regularly, and there has never been a problem, however today is where that all changes. I ordered their bento box and about 3 bites into the rice I see this long oily hair sticking out. I call them and inform them of my issue and they offer to bring me another bento box- which I of course agree to. 45min later I have my new bento box, but low and behold it is not MY bento box. This was 5 stars in my eyes, but now I must drop it to 2.

If it was at least the correct bento box the second time I would have just kept going on with life, but with a grumpy stomach and a mediocre meal, to yelp I go.

Will I order from here again? It's possible. Will the office try a new place next time? Yes.
author: K C.

description: Thought I'd give this place a try because it had pretty decent reviews. But unfortunately I don't think I will be ordering from them again, The order was over 40 minutes late. I usually don't care if it's (30min) half-hour late, but this was just a little bit ridiculous. The food was decent but not worth waiting two hours for it.
author: Charlie M.

description:
This is one of the better food options around the ocean ave area. It is your typical chinese/japanese sushi fare. The food is consistent but theres nothing too special or authentic to the menu. 

I usually order online for pickup through eat24 (yay for $2 off coupons!). I get the bento box with steak&chicken teriyaki with a california roll. It is about $10 (awesome value) after the coupon and is usually ready to pickup within 20 minutes of ordering. The bento box always fills me up and i will be ordering again.
author: Tina O.

description:
Came here with moderate to low expectations for sushi. Coming from LA to SF , I recently had very high expectations for sushi up here. I had been let down every time I've been to sushi in the Bay Area, so coming here I didn't expect much. To my surprise, the sushi exceeded my expectations - barely. We went at 425pm, during happy hour where beer was $2 along with the deal where if you order 2 rolls out of a select few, you get the third for free. 

I ordered the unagi (eel), spicy tuna, and albacore. The waitress took a little while to get our drink order in, and kept us waiting for our beers. The waitress also took quite a while to bring us our check.
Service- 5.75/10

When the food came, I was excited because I was famished, and had low expectations for the sushi. I tried it, and it surprised me. It was actually good. I wouldn't say that it was the most amazing sushi in my life, but for going to a hole in a wall sushi place on a street corner in ingleside, it was lovely. 
Food - 7/10 

I would recommend this place if you're in the area and looking for relatively cheap sushi. The service is very personable, but slow, and the food is above average. 
Overall 3/5
author: Zach M.

description: Less than stellar sushi experience. The rolls weren't wrapped tight enough and fell apart as I was trying to lift them. And they deep fry their gyoza. Talk about disappointing.
author: Melissa M.

description: This place is the worst. We ordered our food on GrubHub and it took over 2 hours to deliver, one hour after the estimated delivery time and after we called them twice to check on it.  Once it arrived, the gyoza was cold and the sushi looked and tasted like it had been sitting out forever. The filling in each roll looked like it had been sent through a meat grinder and the consistency was terrible. We didn't finish any of the rolls even though we were starving by the time the food arrived. Never ordering from here again. On GrubHub, they had a rating of 4.5 stars, WTF? Im def reading the Yelp reviews in advance next time.
author: Harrison M.

description: I love this place!!! Delivery is always on time for me. The sushi is so good & I love the hand rolls. Definetly my to go sushi place.
author: Ashley W.

description: NEVER AGAIN. I frequently ordered delivery from this restaurant, and it's always the same shuck and jive. Promise to deliver within one hour, and then it's 1.5 hours, and then - after calling them to find out where the hell my food is, I get the SAME excuse from Yan every time. "The driver is stuck in traffic." For an hour? Every time? Nope. There are too many good restaurants in this city to even spend another cent at this shifty establishment.
author: Dana S.

description:
Typical Chinese-run pedestrian "Japanese" restaurant. Came into a space that had an old school BBQ joint in it for years. We laughed when they came in, but somehow they stuck it out and now the area has a bunch of yuppie tech rats invading so they tend to like this sort of stuff - Asian and quick ams mediocre, but fits nicely between a keyboard and a monitor.

Service is hit or miss. Food is mostly "okay" if you don't mind the lame Chinese interpretations of Japanese fare. Plenty of those in SF. Some of the rolls can be passable like rock-and-roll, soups not so much, and the teriyaki plate will suffice if you are jonesing. 

Sounds like delivery is worse than horrible, but it's basically a place to walk to when you are too lazy to make a PBJ. Not gonna win any Zagats, but beats out some of the bad restaurants on Ocean simply on cleanliness.   For what they are, the neighborhood could do much worse.
author: T J.

description: rice on the sushi was dry/hard and i was suppose to get a free crunchy roll but they forgot it.
author: timothy n.

description: This place is super legit with a nice atmosphere in a quiet neighborhood and good prices.
author: Christian W.

description: I am really happy and satisfy by the food and customer service that this restaurant provides to the customer. The price is cheap, the boss is really nice and the delivery is quick. I have ordered the food from this restaurant for more than three years, extremely happy by the customer service. This is not the paid review and I haven't gain anything from this review. It's purely the review from my heart. You guys are great!
author: Olive C.

description:
I was unable to leave home for the day so I decided to have my order delivered from here. I ordered through Eat24 and this was the only place that was open and had ramen on the menu. Apparently they have a special where you get a crunchy roll if you order $25 or more, and sadly I did not get a crunchy roll. 

What I did find odd was that there was a $22 minimum on their menu page for Eat24 for delivery, but delivery charge is free if you click on their restaurant info next to the menu so I was unsure about that.

I ordered their Charsu ramen, which the soup did not have much flavor, the noodles were a bit soggy (I requested the soup to be separate from everything). The best part of the ramen was that it had good charsu as it had a good lean to fatty pork ratio.

Next I had two spicy tuna hand roll. Originally I ordered one, but ordered two since I wanted the free crunchy roll (did not get). The tuna was flavorful and had a good amount of spicy to it. The seaweed wrap was a bit soggy, but that was expected since it was a delivery order.

Lastly I ordered their five piece sashimi. No complaint here.

I most likely wouldn't order from here again.
author: Danny F.

description:
Whenever I have a japanese craving, I always go to Geary, Irving, Clement areas. It kinda sucks since I live in the Excelsior/Outer Mission Area, the places I like are across town and parking is hard to find (EVEN with my hatchback yaris)

I always pass this place when I go home after a long day of school at SFSU. Typically good asian restaurants around my neighborhood are hard to find, and I was surprised at how good this place is.

I found parking right in front, dined in and ordered the bento box, with california roll, gyoza and chicken teriyaki (Yeah I know, the generic americanized order). Everything was delicious! It was a little difficult getting the waitress attention sometimes. 

I'll def be back to try it again.
author: Sophia G.

description:
I am devastated to stay I am officially 100% over Yama sushi. 

I used to LOVE this place, inside was nice and well kept, the food was amazing, and best of all it's less than 10 minutes from my house- although delivery always seems to take an hour.... 

Yama got new owners and since then everything is TERRIBLE! 

Given my history with Yama, I give it try after try, supporting local business and hoping it's a fluke horrible experience and everytime I'm extremely disappointed. The fish isn't the freshest, the rolls are way too big, sloppy, cut in all different shapes-if cut at all. And those are the rolls you pay for! If you feel so daring as to order $25 worth of food from this place, when they offer you a free crunchy roll, trust me just say no thanks. Every single time they fill the roll with the disgusting grey part of the salmon!!!! Everytime! 

Lastly, the delivery man is just the most miserable, unpleasant person. Last time I ordered, I forgot the tip upstairs bc I usually put it on the card and he basically demanded the tip. 

Despite it being the closest sushi place to my house, I WILL NEVER WASTE MY MONEY HERE AGAIN!!!!!
author: Rita B.

description: Ordered a bento box and chicken Katsu for delivery through Eat24. Ordered beef teriyaki for my bento box it could have had more sauce but most of the sauce got soaked up by a dolly paper that was under my tempura. Also, a little bit more dressing for the small salad that was included in the meal.
author: Cynthia T.

description: Their delivery time is pretty fast，but the food was quite average.I order the tiger rool and volcano roll and it wasn't anything too special,If you just want some average sushi then you should choose this place,definitely.
author: Bri G.

description: Fantastic little spot! I live very close by and was crazing some sushi tonight. I knew about this place, but never tried it. I was feeling lazy and I really never order sushi to go, but this time I did and am very satisfied! I didn't know what to get so I just ordered the bento box mix. I came home and the miso soup was still very hot, fish was cold and fresh and the ginger was amazing. Great place for my first try.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
For a sushi restaurant located in a neighborhood,  it's okay.  We ordered a rainbow roll and a couple others and not going to lue, but we have had better.  

The sushi didn't taste that fresh and the quality wasn't that good either. I think it was the tuba that tasted and smelled bad... so we stopped eating that. Prices are moderately high too. I haven't explored too many sushi places in the city, but this one is close by.  

Their beer selection is ok too and they do have some specials. Customer service is good, it seems like a family running the business.  Parking is along the street or throughout a neighborhood.  If you live near by I would check it out, I might have just had a bad experience but they are super friendly and seem to be genuine people.  C+
author: Justin B.

description: I love that this place delivers. Cheap, but pretty good. Definitely not a 5-star sushi restaurant, but the quality of the food is good.
author: Kaela R.

description:
Food: Mediocre.  Not the most flavorful kind that I would like on a cold and muggy day.
Price: A little higher than I expected for a lunch benton box. 
Schedule: I had my food delivered and they were right on time.  I asked if they could be at my work place by 11:30am and they showed up at 11:32am.  Great job!
author: Kris L.
