description:
This is a take out only review as Ive never been to the restaurant.  

Sushi was decent considering how small the portions are. Im not looking for huge portions but the nigiri is something like 1 1/2" long compared to 2-2 1/2" normally.  

Eat sushi its good for ya!
author: Joseph M.

description:
Worst Sushi I have ever had in San Francisco.   Deserves NEGATIVE STARS

I ordered delivery through grub hub.  My order arrived with cold almost frozen in the center Gyoza, Cold Steak Terriyaki, and warm almost hot sushi that all the fish was dried out and inedible.  The sushi rolls tasted and looked like they were made hours prior and they just sat out on the counter.  They actually had a funky taste to which made me hesitant to eat more then one piece, fearing I may get sick.  Why would you mess around with raw fish and risk it.  The fish on one of the rolls was a powdery consistency and was hard like cement on top of a roll.  

Having just spent $60 on this order I contacted Grub hub seeking a refund on the ground that my meal was inedible and they tried to talk to the restaurant to get a refund after explaining to them the situation.  The restaurant said no so I spoke to them personally.  They refused to refund me money claiming they do not have any money from my order and all they could offer me was a free roll. (as if I would ever eat from here again)  I explained to the restaurant that i had tasted one of the rolls and immediately felt sick and couldn't eat the meal.  Their excuse was "It was hot today", mind you I ordered at 7pm and it was 65 degrees outside- how is that relevant?  The restaurant ended up telling me "they would refund my money if they had it, but grubhub keeps it"


So I tried again with Grub Hub and told them that the restaurant said they would approve a refund if they had the money, just as the restaurant had told me.  Grub Hub spoke to them and tried to get authorization... but the restaurant said no they would not give me a refund because I ate the meal!  CAN YOU BELIEVE THAT!

This place not only makes dangerous food, they even lie through their teeth.   They should not be in business.

To top it all off I ended up getting sick later that night with stomach cramps which was because of their nasty dangerous sushi (I ate nothing else that night).

So do not order from this place unless you want to risk getting sick from bad fish and wasting your money and being lied to.

I intend to file a formal complaint with the health department regarding this restaurant and it is entirely the restaurants fault because of the way they handled the situation.

If a customer complains to you, you should do everything possible to make things right.
author: Shawn A.

description:
Pros:
- they have happy hour prices here (before 5pm, I believe)
- my bf loves this place because he can custom-make one of his specialty rolls (he calls it the Mexican Hulk: Spicy Hamachi, shrimp tempura, and green onion inside the roll with more spicy hamachi on top sprinked with sesame seeds.  Super yummy.  And I think they charge him like $12 for the roll, which is not bad at all).
- one of my favorite rolls here is their B52.  
- their baked mussel is pretty good also.
- And unlike some sushi places, they do not close between 3-5pm.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Horrendous for takeout. They do not deliver and when you call after an hour and a half, they put you on hold for 15 minutes while you hear mandarin (not Japanese) being yelled for 10 minutes before you lose patience and hang up.

Maybe they are good dining there, but never order takeout from here.
author: Dylan D.

description:
The good thing is that they have this happy hour special from 1 to 5 pm 6 out of the 7 days. The bad thing about this place is that they have this happy hour special from 1 to 5 pm 6 out of the 7 days.

For 6.95 you can get 2 very small pieces of lollipop chicken wings, a bowl of rice, store bought gyoza from 99 ranch, and 4 pcs. of california roll. They also have 1 dollar sushi, maguro, salmon, hamachi, unagi. One phrase to best describe the deal. "You definitely get what you pay for!!!"

The salmon and tuna was crunchy in texture.  How is that possible?!?  I can't find one thing I liked. Even the broccoli was cold.
author: jason g.

description:
This review is for delivery: 

Do NOT order from here if you're hungry. They do not deliver within the estimated time at all. I called the restaurant and the lady told me that the delivery guy left 20 minutes ago, he didn't show up for another 50 minutes. Also, do NOT order from here unless you lack tastebuds. 

The sushi came luke warm, I was a little afraid to eat it. I got the spicy scallop and spicy salmon hand roll and they were half assed. Literally pieces of salmon and scallop smothered in spicy mayo with a slice of avocado. The spider hand roll was the only decent food I ate, but nothing special. What really upset me was that they didn't even bother including ginger and wasabi! 

The hot food came cold, miso soup was cold as well. The chicken teriyaki tasted like boiled chicken, rubber-like and lacking teriyaki sauce, difficult to eat and flavorless. The gyoza was soggy and cold. The only thing edible was the tonkatsu. 

Will not be ordering from this restaurant again, ever.
author: Anh P.

description: They were almost an hour late delivering my order. They arrived 25 minutes after I called Eat24. All the food was ok, but then after I digested the sushi I got sick (food poisoning). The delivery guy called before even knocking and made me come outside. Like another reviewer, I am also upset with myself for adding a tip onto this order pre-delivery.
author: Virginia C.

description: Great local spot. I love the #71 (Cali roll w/ baked scallops on top) and #79 (deep fried tuna roll w/ cream cheese) -- I don't remember the names, sorry :/ Tempura app is also delicious. Service is always quick and friendly., and everyone working there is super sweet! Ok, I did find a hair in my salad once...and now seeing other similar reviews, I had to speak up, too. "Luckily" it was at the bottom of the bowl, so I got to enjoy most of my salad ;) Good soup, quick delivery, just keep an eye out for strays.
author: Sarah F.

description: Placed  order via the Grubhub app.... ordered  happy sushi and 1 yama bento box (teriyaki salmon, mixed tempura and some shredded beef thing ) . Food took an hour and a half. Bento box food was cold. .. sushi looked disgusting.  Small fly in my California roll.  Complete waste of money. Never again. . Should of stuck to Sushi Raw.
author: Carmina C.

description: Yama curry was not what I expected at all. It was katsu with curry sauce spooned over. The curry didn't have much flavor and only had these small 1x1cm diced potatoes. Probably every 1/3 potatoes weren't even cooked all the way. Ordered delivery from a third party site but the restaurant delivers themselves. Ended up getting delivered on time but was missing an item however, the third party did get them to ok the refund.
author: Xbbygirl X.

description: I ordered to go to eat at a friend's place that's 2 blocks away. When I got here, I was surprised at the all women (or majority women) sushi chefs at this restaurant. I really liked that and I wanted this restaurant to be good, but this place lacks quality fish. When I ask about the freshness of the uni, I really want a honest opinion. Because I hate hearing a "yes, it's fresh" and the uni reeks and tastes like toilet. Not only that, I ordered 2 orders (4 pieces) of the uni nigiri and what I got was 3 pieces. Maybe I should thank them for that? I also asked about how many pieces is the croquette so I can determine how many orders I needed for my party. The waitress said 4 pieces and 3 pieces came. Overall, I'm not happy with the food here which really disappointed me. I wanted this place to be good!
author: Jason W.

description: As Im sitting here eating my so so sushi, some guy is clipping his nails at the table behind me- pretty sure he works here. I won't be coming back.
author: Evan O.

description:
First time I ordered delivery from Yama Sushi I was a little skeptical. I ordered the Bento Box with Chicken Terriyaki, California Rolls and Mixed Tempura, I also ordered the Chicken Terriyaki plate for my aunt. The order arrived early and that made me more skeptical because I thought it may be under cooked or what not. Well to my surprise, the food was hot, fresh and very tasty! I haven't had Japanese for awhile so I was crossing my fingers just after I ordered delivery through Grub Hub all the way until it arrived about 45 minutes later!  

I will definitely order again from Yama Sushi. Delivery person was friendly and genuinely interested in my eating experience being the best I ever had! 

Thanks Yama Sushi!
author: Cesar B.

description: Found this diamond in the ruff after working all day at a nearby coffee house. Yama is not only delicious, it is also very inexpensive. The spicy garlic edamame, wow!!!! Super tasty! It is by far the best edamame I have ever had. I also had the croquette, which a potato patty that is breaded, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. I am usually not a big fan of fried anything, but my boyfriend ordered it and  had me try it. Another tasty dish and not all greasy. Lastly I had a cucumber, avocado roll that was very yummy as well. We also had the tofu skin roll, and hot teas and the bill came out to $16.78.  The place is located in a neighbor with nothing but houses so it may be hard to find. It you are in SF By the foglifter coffee and need some grub and you like sushi joints I recommend trying this place. Great food and great prices.
author: Joann C.

description:
Ordered Take out last night. 

I had the chicken kara ag. We also ordered Chicken Tatsu, Bento Box, and a couple rolls. Took about 30 minutes to arrive and was nice and hot. Order was spot on.
The chicken Tatsu was tasteful but it tasted more like chicken tempura haha. The Tatsu was great. My friends enjoyed there stuff and said it was all good, but no one loved it. Definitely not a bad place to order in.
author: Benjamin B.

description: Ordered sushi and bento box for delivery. The bento box BBQ chicken and rice were tasty. The miso soup, bland but the sushi was simply gross. The fish was gray and the rice soggy.
author: Nyna R.

description: Love this place cause its the only japanese restaurant that opens for lunch and delivery. Also love that it's 1 of the few place that offer changing your sushi to brown rice  though they dont have the most variety of rolls, their salmon sashimi is fresh and yummy!
author: Jenny N.

description:
Yay for Happy Hour! They don't always provide the Happy Hour Menu so don't forget to ask if you drop by in the afternoon.

Decent, Quick Sushi fix - nothing amazing, nothing terrible.
-A bit overpriced for OK sushi if you aren't ordering off the Happy Hour menu
-Ran by all Asian women, service varies. 
- Parking never seems to be a problem

I see a lot of locals order in for pick up. The place gets quiet in the day. I'd only go here for there lunch combos during happy hour, for about 7$ you get a nice plate of food. 

Had a super disgusting, unhygienic experience with one of the waitresses before... She was clearly sick and coughing all over our food and plates behind the counter. She was touching her face and wiping her nose with her hands and not ONCE washed her hands afterwards! It was pretty gross watching her bring out our food while coughing on it, definitely decreased our appetites, maybe they should have sent her home that day. Besides that, this place always gets the job done.
author: Mary D.

description:
I ordered delivery on grubhub and had to order a few things to make the $15 minimum:

pork ramen - the pork itself was fine, but the noodles were soggy and mushy and not actual proper ramen noodles, the "vegetables" that came in the dish were a few slices of carrot and two pieces of broccoli, the broth was bland, and it was cold

gomae - I've never had a bad gomae in my life before this :( it was terrible, it was in this mayo-ey sauce that was totally unnecessary, why??!

avocado roll - thank god for the delivery minimum because I couldn't stomach more than a bite of the previous two dishes, so at least the avocado roll passed. 

never again.
author: Sara D.

description: Don't ever order from here for delivery. They didn't even make the two hour window. 3 hours and still nothing. Wow. Fuck this place. They should be paying me for wasting my time.
author: Tony L.

description:
This place is nothing fancy but its near my school and the prices are relatively decent if you go for lunch they have some pretty good specials.

I've never really eaten anything bad here but on the other hand I haven't had anything that was mind-blowing either. I do like the fact that they serve pickled dykon as a part of every meal on the side. Free little appetizers are always a plus.

I would say the best deal they have the lunch box Because you get the best bang for your buck.

Parking never seems to be a problem.
author: Krystal T.

description: I order from Yama often. All their selection is good, the bento boxes are excellent but my fave is the Yama Wonton Soup. The delivery time is usualy pretty good!
author: Andre Z.

description: This sushi place will fulfill your sushi craving best its not that good.  Ordered for pickup and the food was ready in 15 minutes.  The fish wasn't that fresh.  I might eat here again in the future
author: Carter N.

description:
I found myself craving sushi in the middle of the afternoon a couple weeks ago, and there were only a few places that were open and delivering at the time. Despite the mixed reviews and personal thoughts that this might be a bad idea, my craving and my willingness to try a new sushi place overrode any doubts I might have had. Well, lesson learned.

I ordered online so the only customer service I experienced was from the delivery guy. All of that was fine. He was at my door at the time promised and courteous enough. I was just glad he was not late (as other reviews suggested may happen) because I had to go to work.

The sushi, however, was what merits this 1-star review. As soon as I opened the clear plastic container, I could just see the poor quality of the fish. The color was just a bit off. It didn't smell especially bad, but I could tell it wasn't as fresh as I know it can be.

Eating it became a challenge. I ate exactly half of my two rolls and two pieces of nigiri before I had to give up and throw it away. When sushi makes you gag, that is a really bad sign. It was very disappointing.

It looks like others have had good experiences here, and maybe I just ordered the wrong thing on the wrong day. In that case, consistency is an issue and it's all a gamble. If you are feeling that adventurous, try your luck. Otherwise, I cannot recommend this place. I'll stick to the places I know are great.
author: Mick Z.

description: This was my first and last time ordering from this restaurant. I ordered delivery through GrubHub. For starters, the meal arrived late. Once I opened it up, everything seemed ok, except I didn't see the salmon skin roll. There was instead something that looked like a roll filled with tempura batter, which I can't eat. I decided to try the spicy scallop roll, which is usually my favorite, but it was completely inedible -- I actually spit it out. A few of the other items were disappointing, but edible. I don't usually do this, but I actually called them and let them know the salmon skin roll was missing from the order. She asked me to hold on and I heard some yelling back and forth -- it wasn't in English, but it didn't sound like Japanese either. She came back on the phone and told me it was in the order. I said it wasn't, unless she meant the tempura batter roll. She said yes, they tempura fry it. I told them that, had I known that, I wouldn't have ordered it as I can't eat that. I've ordered salmon skin rolls from dozens of different places and it is never tempura battered. She said that is how they make it. I suggested they mention that in the description as it is not typical. She just repeated that's how they make it. She was quite rude. I said since I can't eat it, and they didn't indicate it was tempura fried, I'd appreciate it if it would be taken off the bill. She said, yet again, that's how they make it. I told her I won't be ordering from them again. She simply said OK and hung up. I never even got to mention that the spicy scallop roll was by far the worst I've ever had. I threw both rolls in the trash. What a waste of money!
author: Molly M.

description: First time ordering at this place, got it delivered to me fairly quickly. I ordered 4 orders for California roll & 1 order of volcano roll. Everything was fairly good. Sushi are too small thou.
author: Jingle A.

description:
happy hour rolls are buy one get one half off (~8-10/roll full price)...but no one was really in the restaurant, I don't know why two rolls and one nigiri order took almost 20 minutes

fish was not fresh, and it was subpar quality rolls nasty, not going again
author: Long C.

description: Not great sushi. I never understand how a sushi place doesnt get the  rice! It was tasteless and bland. Fish was ok...it was what I can get at the supermarket....won't porder from them again.
author: Eileen G.

description:
I really wished this Sushi restaurant was good because it is the nearest sushi restaurant in my neighborhood. 

When I first walked in, the waitress didn't really greet my party. She only pointed at the table next to a window without saying a word. And then, she dropped off the menu and two cups of tea, again, without a word.

We ordered dragon roll(eel and tempura shrimp), red dragon roll (tuna and tempura shrimp), and two pieces of spicy tuna. For dragon roll, there is no way to mess it up, i give them that. However, the tuna on both red dragon roll, and spicy tuna were NOT fresh  AT ALL. All the orders were really really slow (I mean how hard could it be?). When I was on my walk out, I saw the girl (the chef) working at the sushi bar and working slowly. I bet they buy those sushi roll mold from Daiso and create some nasty looking and nasty taste sushi. 

For the food, 0 star, both appearance and taste
For the services? Neg 5, Why? The waitress never said a word to us. Even when we were ordering, she just stood in front of us with her notepad ready, again, without saying a word. However, there were two Chinese customer came here, apparently, they knew each other. The waitress kept speaking in Chinese to them. 

I have nothing against Chinese owned Japanese restaurants, but, please keep up with the game. I want some good fresh sashimi, and delicious japnese cuisine
author: Evan L.

description:
They deliver and they are the only sushi restaurant in Ingelside.... 
Everything was fresh, but nothing was amazing.  They have pink ginger (see sushi faux pas).  I wouldn't call this place authentic, but if you find yourself in the neighborhood and you NEED sushi, it serves the purpose and they are clean and friendly and you wont get sick.  
If you live in the delivery area, it again serves the purpose.
author: D M.

description:
I orderYama  Bento Box   $ 12.95,  The miso soup was the best part,  The  california   roll ,  Pork   katsu and  Fish  katsu   are  very  good,  the waitress   can  speak  Cantonese and  friendly,  There are much better sushi restaurants out there but this place satisfy ,  because  the food  are   pretty good, and   the   price   is  very fair

我要了Yama便當盒$12.95，味噌湯是最好的,  加州卷，豬肉豬排，魚肉餅都非常好，服務小姐可以講廣東話和友好,  有很多更好的壽司餐廳,   但這個地方我已經滿足. 因為食物都還不錯，價格也很公道.
author: Eric W.

description:
DON'T PROMISE WHAT YOU CAN'T DELIVER (A Cautionary Tale)

--Strike One--

The first time we ordered from this miserable operation they forgot one of our rolls, a salmon skin handroll.  It happens.  They promised to "make it up to us" by giving us one of those rolls next time we ordered. I put that in quotes because telling someone they can get what they've already paid for by coming back and *spending more money* later is a cheap, tacky imitation of customer service. 

--Strike Two-- 

Anyway, despite the mediocre food, we chose them again tonight, in part because their fuckass sushi extortion scheme meant we had to order from them again if we ever wanted to get the roll we'd already paid for.

The extremely abbreviated version of what happened tonight is that the delivery guy refused to come up to our door. He called us from his cell phone and had us buzz the door over and over, all the while claiming that the door buzzer wasn't working. Little did he know:

1) we had the intercom on and didn't hear his voice coming through it, meaning he wasn't standing in front of the door like he said he was; and 
2) WE COULD SEE HIM SITTING IN HIS CAR, SINCE WE LIVE ON THE THIRD STORY. 

I finally just came down and got the food myself, as I'm sure was his intention.

--Strike Three--

When we placed our order, we made sure they knew about the roll we'd been shorted the last time.  They promised it would be included this time, along with ANOTHER FREE ROLL for our trouble!!! Woot!! Free food!! I've still got money in my bank account from 2006 but free ANYTHING gives me a rock-hard boner fast enough to flip my coffee table over. I was hype. 

Now, would you even believe me if I told you the missing roll that started this whole pathetic saga wasn't even in the fucking bag? Could you honestly believe that shit? Cuz I sure as fuck couldn't believe it when we opened up the delivery bag and there was no salmon skin hand roll (they gave us some other, random salmon roll), and....AAAND......wait for it........no free, extra boner-inducing roll either!!

If I ever see the shady, cheap, dishonest, lazy people that run this place in actual life, I will two-handed 360 windmill dunk their fucking faces into a flaming trashcan. Fuck them and everybody they love.
author: Jay S.

description: Horrible service. I ordered delivery from here and they said it would be at my house in an hour. After an hour and thirty minutes had gone by I decided to call and check in. They proceeded to put me on hold for 5 minutes while they called the driver then told me that the driver was outside. I went outside, and nothing. Waited there for another 5 minutes and still nothing. I called back again and they put me on hold. Turns out they never even made the order. THEY JUST FORGOT ABOUT IT. Then decided to lie to me. Never ever ever ordering from here.
author: Lexii U.

description:
Come on.

I come here quite a bit and it's been pretty okay to quell a small appetite for Japanese food. But this takeout experience has definitely soured my attitude toward this place and I'd much prefer to take my 20 bucks elsewhere and get pizza or something (which I suppose is mostly consistent and delicious).

How about putting it on the menu that the Dynamite roll has chunks of cream cheese in every bite? I strongly dislike cream cheese in sushi. I know that sushi joints like to spread their ponzu or special house sauce on every roll, but no way in hell should cream cheese be used that liberally. And if it is, SAY SO ON THE TAKEOUT MENU.

How about you remove all the tiny bones from a fish before using it on a roll? No one expects to bite down on a roll and get their gums and the roof of their mouth get pricked and jabbed with fish bones. That shit better be cleaned and deboned thoroughly. Instead, I'm the one picking out bones and chewing with extreme caution. This, to me, is simply unacceptable for a sushi place. Especially since people, especially KIDS, who haphazardly eat everything when they're hungry might actually choke.

I'm probably done giving the local neighborhood joint more chances. Enough is enough.
author: Dan K.

description:
After a bad lunch experience I will avoid this place in the future. I was craving seafood and nothing else was close and from the outside Yama looked like a better bet than anything else in the neighborhood. The restaurant was almost empty and I ordered three small dishes - hamachi, oysters and a fish katsu. The service was quite slow considering the staff outnumbered the diners 6 to 1.

The kitchen staff, sushi chef and one man who I believe was an owner were bickering very loudly in Mandarin during my entire meal, so loud that I could hear every word of their conversation, even from the folks all the way in the back of the kitchen. The whole experience was unnerving and exactly the opposite of the quiet and relaxing atmosphere that most Japanese restaurants try to evoke. I even heard the owner mention something about MSG - which, from the context, seemed to indicate that they were using it in at least some of their food. This would come back to me in about an half hour when my head and body started to feel slightly off- my typical MSG reaction.

The fish was not absolutely terrible - not inedible - but there was something about it that felt cheap. What was certain is that it had none of the mildly salty and earthy oceanic flavors that I've experienced with places that carefully select the seafood they offer. What I had here tasted like it was sourced from whatever  wholesale fish vendor was cheapest.

The strangest part is that the whole meal left me with a feeling of heaviness and indigestion. I guess I am to blame to going to a random sushi joint for my fish fix.
author: Alan S.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite sushi places until about 2 years ago. I'm not sure what changed, but the service started getting worse as the servers kept leaving. 

Food-wise, I feel the sushi quality is OK, nothing to write home about. Not a bad sushi place for the neighborhood, but you can easily find better options if you have a car and can drive a few more miles.
author: Avi C.

description:
I will first start with the fact that this restaurant is 4 blocks away from my house. I love that I can just walk down the street to get some Japanese food if I'm really craving it.
However, the problem is that it's not anything special or priced cheaply enough for me to go to them specifically. This is your average run of the mill Japanese restaurant. I've had their udon, a couple of their rolls, and some of their boxes. Nothing on their menu has jumped out at me or made me want to crave their foods.
The service was good considering every time I go, it's never busy. My suggestion is that if you're really craving some good Japanese food, go somewhere else. But if you're in the Ingleside area and feeling lazy, go here. It's good enough to satisfy your sushi craving.
author: Chris L.

description: This establishment has absolutely no respect for its customers. I've been ordering from yama about a year, but once every 3 orders they would leave out an item or make a mistake. I'm usually a pretty chill customer but I started to realize this was happening way too often. The Asian lady on the phone 'manager' was unapologetic and disrespectful making bs excuses everytime I called to inform them of its mistakes. So after its final mistake on game 5 for the warriors, I called her to let them know I will never be ordering from them again. She couldn't care less. I feel bad for their delivery drivers. Never Again!
author: kevin c.

description:
Suddenly I was craving sushi for lunch so my boyfriend and I trekked out to Yama Sushi. Street parking is abundant so don't be afraid to drive here. The place isn't anything fancy, but the service is attentive and food is good. My water glass stayed full and the portions were well sized. I ordered the seawead salad, philadelphia roll, and tiger roll-- which was exceptionally tasty, but a little on the smaller side. The rolls didn't have too much rice, which I liked. My boyfriend got the Bento Box for I believe $11.95 and it was huge! He definitely left well fed and he can eat. All in all I'll be going back when I need a quick and easy sushi fix.


They also let you phone in orders or make an online order for pick up!
author: Sandhya R.

description: Great Sushi! Delivery is pretty fast. The teriyaki isn't the best, I don't recommend it. But the gyoza is pretty great!
author: D H.

description:
I've ordered twice now through eat24 and eaten there a half dozen times. Each time it has been delicious. I was a little worried when I saw 30-60 minutes for delivery (we had been cleaning house all day and didn't want to go anywhere). Our order arrived hot and in 20 minutes! My nephew and sushi partner were delighted and can't wait to order again.

We got the crunchy roll for free with our order but we are still unsure as to what is in it. Anyone have a clue? I asked a waiter and he said he didn't know. There is definitely a little bit of a language barrier but they are polite and courteous.
author: Melinda C.

description:
This review is based on an order I got to-go. 

I ordered a bento box with sushi, california roll, and sashimi I believe. The miso soup was the best part. The rest of the meal was less than good. For $13 with tax is was more than enough food, but the quality was just not there. So even if $13 was cheap, it was a waste of money because the food was just not satisfying. Maybe I'll try dining in to see if that makes a difference.
author: Saralee L.

description: Neighborhood sushi spot, not bad if you go for happy hour i went around 1:30 and got a bento box chicken and beef teriyaki. Comes with miso soup, salad and rice for under $9
author: Jennifer R.

description: Neighborhood sushi spot.  I've eaten in, ordered delivery and did their catering, and their service is superb.  Food is average quality but decent pricing.
author: Ju D.

description:
Happy Hour 1-5pm, 7 days a week! If you buy the sushi on their happy hour menu you get the 2nd sushi roll half off. They charge you the full price for the sushi roll that is more expensive and the least expensive one will be half off. Also, they do have bento boxes that goes for less than $7.

My favorite rolls: Bay Scallop (Spicy) & Godzilla!
author: Janice V.

description:
I got the Yama bento and the potato cakes because of the $15 minimum for delivery - otherwise I would have just ordered a smaller dish. Good thing I did though, because I ended up not eating half of the bento. 

Do NOT get the fish katsu or the beef teriyaki. They clearly did not use the right type of fish for frying, which resulted in a very unappetizing fishy flavor and over-cooked rubbery texture, and the beef was extremely chewy and undercooked.

The miso soup, california rolls, salad, and potato cakes were great and redeeming. But at the same time, it seems hard for a Japanese restaurant to mess those items up, so I'm not entirely sure if that's worthy of congratulations.

The delivery was prompt.
author: Jen L.

description: Ordered delivery on Eat 24, so I got a 2 dollar coupon. Without tip, I got 2 large pieces of maguro nigiri, an avocado roll, a spicy tuna roll, and a tekka maki for just under $15. Not bad. Delivery wasn't prompt but it wasn't that slow. Like other reviewers said, the guy was very insistent about the cash tip. Sushi wasn't great but it wasn't terrible. I hate having mediocre sushi though so I probably won't order from them again. Great if you want cheap, okay sushi delivered.
author: Emma M.

description:
I really like the Volcano and Three Amigos rolls at Yama Sushi. You HAVE to go here during Happy Hour for the buy one roll, get one half off special. Average price is about $10/roll. Honestly, this isn't nearly the best sushi in SF but out of sheer proximity to my house, I've managed to eat here quite a few times. 

DO NOT GET THEIR MOCHI; it's awful. The doughy exterior is dry and flakey, not soft and gooey like it should be. And one ball is $2.50. Total balls!
author: Kristen F.

description:
This is for online delivery. 

Usually, this place is okay because they deliver sake. BUT, this time the delivery took more than an hour, and then after I got the food and closed the gate, the delivery guy came running up, knocked on the gate, and kept saying I owed him more tip in cash! 
I felt bad and pressured so I ran into my house and grabbed some more cash for him... But I really do not appreciated being pressured like that. 
What would he have done if I refused? Spit in my future orders? Just for that I would be hesitant ordering again... 

Food was alright. Not the best but it was delivery so what the hell.
author: Florence A.

description:
A favorite of mine.

 I always passed this place on my way to SFSU, and in the evenings I noticed it was often busy, which I found surprising because it's not located at a main intersection, but rather in a very residential area. 

I used to get their bento box, which wasn't bad but it wasn't anything amazing either. However, since I've discovered their volcano roll, that is all I ever get. I'm a huge fan of baked salmon, and so their volcano roll is perfection to me! I don't like going to other sushi places now because all I ever want to order is a volcano roll, and not every place has them. 

The service here is also relatively good. Sometimes they take a while to make my order, but the deliciousness of the volcano roll more than makes up for it.
author: Maahum C.

description:
This is my 3rd review for this place. I think the second review was way off base on my part. Except that the place is under new management. So here is my very 1st review of  Yama Sushi because this place still lives up to that review:

 This place is great. I love how it is just down the street from my house. I have tried almost everything on the menu more then once and there is not a lot to complain about when it comes to food. The Gyoza, Teriyaki chicken and beef, Udon, tempera, the fried bananas are some of my personal favorites.

The services is something to complain about. I'm there fairly often and the services is never the same. Sometimes it is fast and on point and other times you have to flag them down to get their attention. Another problem is some of the servers English is not that good. But the food never takes too long and the food is brought to you when it is piping hot!

The food is what will have you coming back for more and that is what really matters!
author: Krystle S.

description:
I've ordered from here three times, mainly because my son loves sushi and I don't want to drive to my favorite spot in south city. 
 I order with eat24 because trying to order food that you can't pronounce and 2 toddlers running around yelling makes it difficult. Well the first time went smoothly,  I even got a free crispy roll, the second time they sent me chicken teriyaki instead of chicken katsu (I didn't really mind though)...but today was a pain in the @$$ I placed my order and it said 45 minutes, like usual well not this time the guy came an hour and 20 minutes later, but he didn't come upstairs to my door nor did he plan to. The reason I know he was outside was because my hungry son was watching out the window and told me he was finally here. 
This must have been a new guy because he walked back to his car, I yelled over to him if he was from yama's he looked at me and didn't answer. I yelled over again and he walks back and asked who I am(wtf?) He had a strong accent so I didn't understand too well what he was telling me..15 minute discussion of how he needs me to pay his gas money because he drove really far.   

Really!? So on top of the tip I gave you on my order you want me to give you more -___- ugh I live 5 blocks from there next time I'll walk instead of dealing with some guy that cane late and still asking for more money.

Your two stars are for food. The three you lost is for rude service.
author: Cindy J.

description:
My review has been removed twice.
TWICE! So, I am going to be easy on this time.

100% Chinese.
If you are proud to be Chinese, Why you don't like to notify as Chinese-Sushi?
I never say Chinese-Sushi is bad.
It's a people's reputation, isn't it?

SF Dept of Health score was 68.
Fixed because people noticed.
How the hell you didn't know to begin with?
I just can NOT believe this.
That's it.

Very DISGUSTING place.
Sticky table as any Chinese restaurant but the place serving raw fish.
68 was the SF Health score.
Do you still want Sushi here?
NO THANK YOU.
No more, No less,
Let me getta H- out of here!

Tammy C said, "Oh okay I just saw this. That's not right, your review was totally legit!!! It's a review so people don't end up falling sick after eating there!!! I wonder if Yelp filters the flaggers. Because they should if these are the friends of Yama Sushi!!

Lolia S. said, "They are so harsh with you. You provided useful info in your review."
author: Nobu K.

description:
*Update 5/4/12*
So I will say this - I find owner's responses to Yelp reviewers usually comical and defensive, HOWEVER, I find Yama Sushi's owners responses to SERIOUSLY take into consideration what other reviewers are saying.  That being said - a previous reviewer commented than her broccoli  was raw, the owner replied it was meant for decoration.  The broccoli I got was cooked - blanched and quite edible; a nice addition to my meal.  Though they didn't ask my my preference I was very happy that they took the time to consider other reviewers comments and not post a snide, rude, or holier-than-thou comment.

So I went ahead an re-reviewed them:

Hmm.. so I had a LivingSocial deal.. free $10 to use for take-out or delivery as long as it's through their app.

Okay.. so the closest place (with the most likely parking) is Yama Sushi.  I've tried them before a couple times, several years ago.  And I don't go for the sushi.

Let me say - major improvement.  The California Rolls were surprisingly BIG; and not just big with rice.. there's actually REAL CRAB in there??  And a sizable amount too.

I got their bento box (about $13 with tax) and got a nice scoop of rice, bowl of miso, and unexpectedly decent (if not large) portions of teriyaki fish (salmon) and chicken.  Very happy.

It is a little on the expensive side but because of my coupon I only really paid about $3.  WORTH IT.

I think I'll be coming here a little more often...  but sushi-making girl needs to SMILE when people enter.  That would make a WORLD OF DIFFERENCE.


The salad dressing was kind of addictive :)

*Edit:  some of the chicken was rather pink.. hmm.. hope I don't get sick!
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
This review should actually just be four stars, but because it's half a block away from where I live, it gets an extra star.

I'll have to admit Ingleside is a very... colorful neighborhood and to see a Japanese food place here is refreshing. No, of course you wouldn't expect an "authentic" Japanese owned and run restaurant around here, where the population is mainly Chinese and Black. Yes, I can probably get better Japanese food in Japantown and Japan itself. I understand this.

But I think Japanese food is usually extremely overpriced, and seeing it cheaper on a menu is a nice change. Yama offers the typical dishes and sushi/rolls, about a buck or two cheaper than most places. Their fish has been fresh every time I go.

Service is usually pretty on-point. I like to go in the downtime (like early afternoons, right after the lunch rush) so the employees are usually sitting down to eat, but they never fail to bring me water or refill my glass when it's empty.

The chicken and beef teriyaki is cut very thinly, which is personally preferred. Not a fan of putting big chunks of meat into my mouth that takes five minutes to chew.

All in all, I would go back, simply because it takes me less than two minutes to walk here. Even if they have had health and appearance issues, I see firsthand their efforts in trying to improve the place (when I stumble home late at night). I hope their harsh reviews on here get faded out.
author: Sara K.

description:
If you are a sushi connoisseur, this place will just piss u off. Yama makes an extremely weak effort to give off the vibe of ~Japanese~ when you are there, you are very aware you are in a Chinese restaurant disguised as Japanese. Esp the service! You feel like you are in chinatown! Being ignored, waitresses hustling and bustling, no check in's to see if everything is ok until they give me the check without asking if I wanted anything else.  

First off, happy hour sushi is cheap... Approx 1.25 for nigiri; BOGO 1/2 price on a large selection of rolls, nice bento box lunch specials too around $6-7, a few other things too

My boyfriend and I get sushi very often, plus I used to waitress at a sushi restaurant, so whenever I try a new sushi restaurant, I know what to look for. I order a few things to sample their happy hour menu, 1 sake nigiri; 1 spicy tuna hand roll; 1 philly roll. Total was around $9

Now QUALITY.... Sake nigiri was the best out of the 3; only because of the fish itself. The craftsmanship of the entire sake nigiri was not well done. Salmon to rice ratio was off, too much rice. Salmon cut poorly around the edges, as if the chef just thought, "let me just chop this piece of fish into a rectangle". 
Next, the spicy tune hand roll.... My GAWD, already soggy when it arrived. I know the seaweed on hand rolls can un-crunch quickly, BUT NOT THAT QUICKLY. I already know that crap was constructed at least 10 mins prior to giving it to me. So either they gave me a pre made HR, a HR sent back from another table, or the sushi chef doesn't know basic sushi/seaweed science!!!! HRs are either sent as soon as they are made, or the very last thing created and put on the plate before delivery.... Now to continue with the HR, spicy tuna was an more orange color instead of read, wasn't very good. Also had too much rice.
Finally, the philly roll. I'll make this quick; salmon was meh, they used avocado instead of cucumber which made the roll extremely mushy. Individual attributes of the roll did not stand out, all mushed together in over cooked rice and soggy seaweed. 

Did I mention that everything came to me at room temperature! That's such a pet peeve of mine when it comes to sushi. You want sushi (the fish) cold or at least slightly under room temperature!!!!

Overall, I would not come here if I wanted to *enjoy* my sushi. I would only come if I was having one of my crazy raw fish cravings and needed it NOW! Even so, I would only order their nigiri or sashimi. Everything else was blah
author: Elaine S.

description: I live down the street from this place and have only been here once. It was pretty bad. I'm surprised people come here, their health score is 67. 67!!! anything below 70 is considered poor, 71-85 is considered "needs improvement" just for reference. I just looked into it and on Jan 23rd of 2014 they were cited for "Contaminated or adulterated food." They also dont thaw or store their food properly . You can look it up for yourself on the San Francisco's department of health website (I've taken to looking up the restaurants I might frequent). I would not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Maria P.

description: Was okay. Happen to be walking by and decided to try it out. I had the boneless duck ramen and the duck was pretty good but ramen was mediocre. Restaurant was nice, clean and spacious.
author: Bruce L.

description:
Sushi is very bad. Ordered Salmon Maki. It came with cooked salmon. Later, sushi was replaced. But the salmon looked terrible. I guess that is why they served us cooked salmon in the first place. The salmon color was gray, there were a few pinkish salmon with white stripes in between. When you bite on it, it is crunchy. We left most untouched. 

My husband and I ordered noodle soup. They are both fine though.
author: Wen L.

description: Ive been here twice now and I love it! The service is always friendly, its also the first place ive ever seen women sushi chefs. The tea i believe is burnt rice tea and its delicious. They serve a little mini salad thing which i nom in 2 seconds. Ive had the luck to catch happy hour both times ive been here and its awesome prices. 2$ appetizers and 50% off your second roll from the list. Ive gotten the Dragon and Bay Scallop both times i think, super yummy. A sapporo is 2$ on happy hour too! And the gyoza is crispy yum also. Love this place, and its on top of my list next time im craving sushi, and its decently close to my home! :D Happiness!
author: Courtney T.

description:
Unexpectedly delicious!  We ordered from here over LivingSocial.com one afternoon because our two favorite places don't start delivering until 5pm...and were so pleasantly surprised!  The fish was fresh, the food was on time, and the portions were perfect (not to mention the prices which, for basic maki, are better than most other places).  I would definitely order again.

The spicy yellowtail was our favorite, fwiw.
author: Jillian Y.

description:
This has to be the cutest I-didn't-know-it-was-there-Japanese-restaurant in the city. It's on a residential street where no one would ever expect to find a Japanese restaurant. I've tried a few rolls and the bento so far, and I have to admit that the food is rather average. BUT I definitely think it's worth it for the price you're paying. I do wish they had a bento offering just one or two entrees because the only bento they offer is $12 for 3 items. I think that's a great deal, but I can't always finish the meal and feel like $12 is a little steep afterwards. They do have a child's menu offering meals with two entrees for only around $6 or $7, which maybe I should just get from now on. xD

The service is good, the food comes out quick, the prices aren't bad. Just don't sit by the windows, I noticed a lot of flies around when I sat next to them. I'll definitely go back when I'm craving Japanese close to home.

Oh, by the way, the salads are gross!
author: Enari L.

description: Never had a bad experience here, and they deliver which is nice. The food is pretty good given the price.
author: Rob K.

description: I always appreciate that the delivery is extremely quick, as compared to other delivery experiences I've had in SF. This place always hits the spot when I'm having a craving for sushi.
author: Nicole M.

description:
What the. How did I not know that there was a sushi place four blocks away from my house??

This place far exceeded my expectations. I have eaten at my fair share of crappy Americanized sushi places (see: almost all of the sushi places in Pacifica except for Ocean Fish Sushi), and, yes, Yama Sushi is Americanized, but it's definitely not crappy. 

I came here with my boyfriend and two other people. We got a ridiculous amount of food (I want to say we got like 7 rolls and three appetizers?). 

My faves were:

-Black and white appetizer: Tofu wrapped in eel and seaweed and then deep fried. This was a nice surprise that I haven't seen anywhere else! The tofu was hot and soft, and the eel and seaweed were crunchy. Very yummy!
-Three amigos: Spicy tuna roll with white tuna and hamachi.
-49ers: Spicy tuna roll with salmon and avocado.
-Flaming oysters: Deep fried oysters with a little bit of cream cheese and sriacha sauce. We got two orders of these since they tasted so good.

Service was very nice, and prices were reasonable. I will definitely be a repeat customer!
author: Wendy S.

description: Food was soggy and tasted disgusting I ordered the box with salmon and tempura with a side roll and the tempura was soggy and very dry and the salmon was soggy and rice was very hard !!  I will never order from here again
author: David J.

description: No one is eating here for a reason. As i approach this empty corner restaurant, they immediately asked me, "to go right?" I was gonna eat here but my gut said to just eat at home so i did. I ordered the 3 course bento box. When she gave me my order, i specifically asked if everything was inside and she said yes with a 'get outta here already look'. When i got home, i only got the half assed chicken teriyaki which was probably microwaved. And some veggies that came straight from the plastic bag. So i called and they told me i needed my receipt for a refund which she never handed to me in the first place. Worst sushi place ever
author: Joe D.

description:
This is my go-to sushi delivery joint. They are decent, and the quality is pretty consistent. Delivery times vary depending on time of day. 

Rolls are pretty big. Husband gets Philadelphia roll, loves Crunchy rolls. 

Beef teriyaki entrees are pretty decent as well. Miso soup and salad are not very good.
author: Andrea B.

description: Solid sushi, had this catered to work via Zesty.  Fresh and delicious. I'm a fan.
author: Jay H.

description: Almost 2 hr wait for delivery is unacceptable
author: Luke C.

description:
I mainly come here for their sushi - 3.5 stars. Their fish is pretty fresh (i like their salmon) and they give pretty generous portions for their prices. Both their sushi combos and rolls are good and their hand rolls (i like their spicy tuna and spicy salmon) are great to start with, but I can't say too much about their entree dishes. Their ramen was nothing exciting (something I can probably throw together at home myself) and their beef teriyaki was alright. BUT their grilled hamachi kama was definitely worth it. 

This place is hidden in a residential area, right across from a liquor/corner store. Pretty random location for a restaurant but parking isn't too bad and there is never a wait, so it's good if you're looking to get seated immediately. It's a family operated joint and may not be the MOST efficient (the sushi bar can get a little backed up at times), but they're really nice people and will try to accommodate any changes or substitutions. They may not be the quickest, but they treat their customers well - and that's a biggie for me. 

There are much better sushi restaurants out there but this place satisfy my cravings without me having to stray too far away from home and/or deal with parking in the busier neighborhoods. I haven't tried their delivery yet, but that should come in handy on a rainy day!
author: Ellen N.

description: Ordered delivery. One of the rolls I have order tasted like the fish have been out of water for years. I can't believe they serve food that was overnight and not fresh. It tasted horrible that I had to throw it out. Waste my money.
author: Karen J.

description: We always order sushi 40 pieces. Sushi is good and price is reasonable.
author: Paohui C.

description:
poor fish grade .. the stuff that was suppose be cold like "salad , fish and fruit" was hot! and th stuff that was suppose to be hot was cold as shit .. 

never eat here food poisoning waiting to happen..
author: Marcus M.

description:
It's basically the only sushi place near SFSU... but that doesn't mean it's supreme.

The portions for sashimi are NOT generous... which is disappointing.

PROS: Yama Sushi has a fair happy hour, offers free delivery, and is pretty cheap in general.

CONS: not the most inviting environment, little fish given for sashimi and nigiri, the bathroom isn't clean (makes me question how clean the kitchen may or may not be...)

It may be the only sushi spot in Ingleside near SFSU, but sushi lovers should love elsewhere to satiate their sushi cravings.
author: Drea B.

description: tried this place for the first time - really disappointed.  Out of the 4 rolls, none were good.. My husband liked the soft shell crab and fried oysters.
author: J R.

description: A great well-priced neighborhood find.  The fish was fresh and tasty but the atmosphere is bare bones. It's not worth a trip but it's good if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Virginia T.

description:
Delivery to the Mission.

I was surprised to get soup - nice touch!

Sushi was good - quality was above super-market, at least the rice was fresher.  I am usually sensitive to 'old' fish. The tekka and Rock n' Roll were good.

I also ordered oyako donburi.  Second surprise - the chicken was breaded.  That is unusual.

Will order take out from them again.
author: Steve M.

description: We eat here semi-regularly and order deliveries as well. It's an easy week night spot for the neighborhood. It's not fancy and won't win any awards for best sushi in the city, but for the price, it is a good quality. I can make special requests and they are always accommodating without charging me more.  We've been going hear for at least five years and it's been consistent. I even think their sushi making skills have improved over time. If you live in the neighborhood, check it out.
author: Diana L.

description:
I think I stumbled upon another hidden gem in San Francisco. 

First of all, you can't beat $2 sake and beer. Chill on one beer and keep the sakes coming! 

Miso is nothing special. A little on the bland side but is served piping hot, which I love. Rolls are average $9 and if you buy one roll, you get a roll half off. I got the rainbow roll with the spider roll and let me tell you that it was definitely worth the $13.50. The rainbow roll had fresh sashimi and the soft shell crab in the spider roll, while it wasn't hot, was still nice and crunchy.

Waitress was on her game and kept our hot tea and sake full. 

All amidst the soothing sounds of 96.5 KOIT in the background.
author: Rob C.

description: Last week I ordered from this place. It's not bad but I have tasted better. They seem a little stingy on the tempura they only give you one piece of shrimp tempura and the rest are the vegetables. I would definitely order again since they deliver.
author: Alexandra A.

description: I live in this neighborhood and come here at least once a week. It is quick, delicious, and accommodating.
author: Farrell W.

description: This was my first time ordering from here and I got the teriyaki salmon bento. I was very impressed with the delivery time, though not so impressed with my meal. the sashimi was not cut very well and there was skin on my baked salmon.
author: Valerie N.

description: It's interesting to see this restaurant standing alone on this otherwise all-residential neighborhood (albeit one that has a somewhat sketchy feel). I haven't tried their sushi here, and not sure if I'd expect much.  I did come one afternoon for lunch and tried their tempura item with rice for (I think) just over $10.  It was pretty enjoyable.  The staff seems pretty nice overall, looks family-owned.  The decor is not much to write about though.  If anything, it makes me think of it as something like a large meat deli or market that got converted to a restaurant without much remodeling in the process.
author: H K.

description: After a few hours of dancing, I was starved. I looked this place up on GrubHub, and ordered a Philly roll and one of their basic sushi dinners. Super fresh and delicious fish, and it was pretty cheap for what I got. Definitely will order takeout again.
author: Nancy R.

description: I have to first say, I'm giving them two stars because they deliver. That being said the food came 25 minutes late and was refrigerator cold (even the dishes that should have been hot). The gyoza were rubber. However the one thing I liked was the sushi roll. My advice is stick to the stuff you like to eat cold if you have to order from here.
author: R T.

description: This experience is one of those "I told you so".  Should've listened to the people who gave this place one star.  The dragon roll's shrimp tempura has no shrimp on most of them it's just the breading.  They're free crunchy roll had some black stinky rotten fish in the middle.  The avocado in the avocado roll was already turning black. The rest of my order was ok like the agedashi roll (hard to mess up a fried tofu right?).   Chicken katsu my kids didn't complain about.  There a reason why there's a 184 reviews and they not got three stars!  This place needs a whole lot of improvement.
author: Marie Erika E.

description:
Well. 

I don't like to be a poor rater but I believe that honesty is the best answer to mediate good experience. 

Short and sweet:

Yama sushi is pretty weak. I came in for dinner to go and ordered the rock n roll and the chicken katsu entree. 

Chicken katsu: Came with a salad, rice, and the katsu. 

strike 1: salad dressing was like water. Nuff said. 
strike 2&3: chicken katsu: sliced so thin it was basically made of batter and ultra deep fried-edness. Ultimate weak sauce. 

and forgoing standard baseball rules:

strike 4: miso soup was apparently made out of packet. Now often times preprepared miso paste will be used sure but two things I noticed: 1) the tofu were little blocks that I know from experience (college student!) came out of plastic packet freeze dried. 2) the nori had little to no substance indicating (again) that it most likely came out of a packet. 3) miso was not miso paste: there's an innate quality that miso paste has that this soup basically lacked. It was all grainy and such. 

The rock n' roll roll....well, again I've had better sushi but for like....4 bucks it surprisingly was enjoyable versus the main course. 

Katsu: 8.95 
Roll: 3.95 

15 bucks (with tip) 

tl;dr: the katsu was mediocre as was all the offerings that came with it. the sushi was alright. 

In short: Essentially not good, essentially not worth it. 

Go to K's kitchen up in Glen Park: smidge more expensive but with more attention to detail and far far far far more delicious. 

Last 15 I spend at this place. Sorry yama, I'm no hater but this had to be addressed.
author: Dzu N.

description: Don't use the delivery service from here. Waited 2 hours before I got so fed up that I called and told them forget it. I'm just now seeing all of the other horrible delivery reviews. Why have a delivery service if you can't handle it?
author: sf b.

description: Decent sushi for price and location. I order a spicy salmon roll, more spicy sauce then anything else. Better go to Fuji in west portal.
author: Antonio I.

description: OMG so disappointing... tiny tiny tiny tiny portions and also non delivery of PROMISED items such as soup.
author: Sarah S.

description: Ordered the duck ramen via grubhub. Really not great. The noodles were soggy, broth was bland, and the duck was not boneless as the menu had suggested.
author: Lara O.

description:
This is my favorite sushi place. They are nice, reasonably priced and you get a solid amount for what you pay. It is an old building and is not fancy, but it's clean and very casual. It's a great place to go and eat a bunch of sushi and enjoy a couple of Sapporos with a friend or two. It's in the middle of a neighborhood so mostly homes in the surrounding few blocks, but easy parking. Can't ask for much more.

** I eat a lot of sushi when I go here, so that's why I put  the higher price, but it's very reasonable**
author: Jen O.

description: Food was good but not great. Been here twice, same thing.  Service sucks. But I'd eat here again.
author: Monica W.

description:
I waited a really long time to give this review, because I wanted to cool down from the fury that I had when I had to deal with this place. But even 3 weeks later, I'm still disgusted from it. Seeing the good amount of options and decent reviews, and I love sushi, I ended up ordering food here at 6:00pm online on the website listed here on yelp. 7:30pm rolls around, and I think, "alright they must be busy, let me call them to confirm they got my order."

I called and asked them if my order was on its way, they asked for my address, which I gave to them, and they said that it should be there in 15 minutes. I waited another 30 minutes before I started getting very angry. It's 8:15 when I call them again, this time furious, demanding why it is taking so long for my food. This is a different person I am talking to at this point, and I tell her everything up to this point. She says her system didn't get my order. But I don't understand why I was told it was on the way when I called the first time. I then proceeded to ask for a refund, but she says I would have to call the website I ordered from. I've been through this issue before with other companies, and would rather just get my food than having to deal with this mess more, so I asked them to just send the food. I had to reorder everything, but it's been 2.5 hours by the time I put in the initial order and do not remember what it was, but eventually found it online. 

I thought it was pretty convenient that my order never got to their system, but after my 2nd phone call, I got the order confirmation. When everything was said and done, it was 9:00pm by the time I got the food. They apologized, told me their system was broken (although I think the real reason was they got super busy and forgot to confirm), and gave me two free Temaki sushi for my troubles

The sushi was delicious, I really wanted to not give this place 1 star, but 3 hours for food is unacceptable. Also, I heard them speaking to each other in Chinese (cantonese to be exact), but the voice they imitate on the phone is very stereotypical Japanese. On any other day, it would be a 4 star review, just not today.
author: Phan H.

description: This sushi place is awesome!!!! Nor only is the food really good but the staffs are extremely nice. Definitely coming back to this restaurant. Their delivery boy is always on time if not then early.
author: Andrew H.

description: Not so bad! It is a small and decently run sushi joint, and I appreciate it's location as an SFSU student ;) Prices are average, presentation average, and service slightly above average. The ladies working here do have nice attitude and courtesy when handling customers, so it made my visit a good experience. Bottom line: not the highest quality sushi around, but a good staple restaurant for Ingleside goers.
author: Teresa C.

description: I was excited to order from them, but i recieved lackluster food and service.  Ordered through eat24 and the estimated time of deliver was 35-60 mins. Apparently, delivery only depend on calling and not door belling, so after more than an hour of waiting, i called for follow up and they said they called me earlier.. But didnt ring the door bell?!... Anyway, waited 30 more minutes, the delivery guy wasnt even sympathetic, ate lukewarm soggy food, the karage wasnt too bad though. Had so much better from many restaurants overall in service and food.
author: Iralyn J.

description: Extremely delicious!!!! I found this place couple of years ago with my classmates. This is a small place near San Francisco State University and you be surprised how good their sushi is. Their Bakes Muscles is also to die for and I recommend everyone that loves sushi and muscles to check this place out. Their pieces are decent and their quality is pretty consistent. However, their staff are not friendly and never check up on you to see if you need anything or how you like your food other then that this place rocks!
author: Joseph F.

description: Yama is a little gem. Delivery on late night study sessions? Yes, please! I love me some Yama on my college budget...it's also located in a neighborhood with lots of free parking and not many food choices.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Good affordable Japanese food. Ordered the unagi don and a bento box. Ordering tempura with your bento is highly recommended. Taste almost on par to some places in Japantown for a much cheaper price. Would definitely come back again.
author: Lily L.

description:
I was looking for something to eat the other day in SF with a friend when we stumbled upon this place.  It's located in a residential area and looks pretty decently beat up from the outside, but we decided to try our luck.

I'm not sure what's up with their health history, but the place was VERY clean and i was pretty impressed with the fish.  They have a pretty large selection of nigiri sushi and i got to try a bunch of them and was impressed with the quality.

I would recommend getting a bunch of the nigiri sushi (you can purchase them as single pieces instead of sets of two) because i know that most people won't see a lot of the fish that this place has in a typical japanese restaurant where they usually have the standard hamachi, sake, maguro, etc.

I agree with the previous poster that this place is much better than the reviews proveded a long time ago...but if you ask me, we should keep this a secret so that it's not so crowded the next time i go there :-P

Happy Eating!
author: Bradley H.

description: Solid small Japanese restaurant.  Very full menu considering.  The rolls are the things to get.
author: Qoo G.

description: This place is good for takeout but be forewarned if you eat in that service is lacking. Wait staff doesn't speak English well and often gets order wrong. Food is ok but fish not as fresh as true Japanese (place is run by Chinese). There doesn't seem to be management, just large staff of Chinese women. I will not eat in again.
author: Michelle O.

description:
Fellow Yelpers:
I'll make this short and sweet. 
I ordered sushi and mixed tempura through Grubhub.com (sake, toro and hamachi) and it was inedible. The toro and hamachi were grayish-brown and smelled rotten. The sake looked like it had been cut with a chainsaw. 
I called Grubhub customer service to let them know how disgusting my order was and they said they would call Yama Sushi and then call me right back...this is where things get horrifying.
Yama Sushi said they KNEW the sushi was bad but the tempura was "fine" and they would only refund me for the sushi.
So, they knew the sushi was inedible yet they delivered it anyway. No one from Yama Sushi called to say the fish had gone bad, no one called to suggest ordering something different...they KNOWINGLY delivered rotten raw fish. Like I wouldn't notice? And what if I didn't know any better and got food poisoning? Am I the only one who gets how wrong this is? 
I threw the "fine" tempura (that I was not refunded for) in the trash because who knows what the quality of shrimp and vegetables were under all that oil. 
Customer safety and satisfaction are clearly not important to Yama Sushi.
author: Jenn B.

description:
Outstanding sushi and ramen noodles. 

I get the Franciscan roll almost every time and its excellent. Good spicy tuna and spicy salmon (not too saucy). Great sashimi as well. I've ordered several of the bento boxes at lunch which are good and inexpensive (the terayaki dishes were good and the chicken katsu was great)

Ordered the banana/green tea ice cream dessert once and was BLOWN AWAY. Its not expensive. It is delicious and huge. Next time I have two people to split it with I'll get it again!

I also love the complimentary pickled veggies that come out before the meal. Well done.

Prices are VERY reasonable. 

The decor is nice after the recent makeover (new floors, new sign, not sure what else). 

The staff is very friendly. Sometimes a little slow.
author: James F.

description: This is the closest sushi spot I have to me it's ok nothing special and yet not that bad just ok.. I usually get the bento box which is def has big portions.. The fish seems pretty fresh which is one of the reason why I keep coming back.
author: Jared V.

description: My girlfriend suggested this place for our date night last Saturday and I'm glad she did! The place was empty to begin with so I was a little skeptical, but I couldn't complain when the food came out. The tempura mix was a reasonable price for the amount of pieces they gave us and the rock n roll and tiger rolls were very good. Not to mention, our servers took good care of us and never left our glasses empty. I will definitely be back soon.
author: Nicholas R.

description:
Gross!!!

Got take out from here last night. The majority of my meal was inedible. I got the Bento box with California Rolls, Gyoza, and Beef Teriyaki.

The beef teriyaki is one of the worst teriyaki's I've ever had the in city. Chewy and yet somehow undercooked and I'm pretty sure I bit into bone at one point before I threw it out.

California rolls were also disgusting, chunks of brown and most of them were falling apart.

Gyoza's were COLD as if they had never been heated to begin with.

ALSO  the delivery driver didn't say a single word. Not a thanks, nothing. And I had tipped well too. He just handed me my food and walked out. 

NEVER ORDERING AGAIN.

It's bad when the best part of the meal is the miso soup ....
author: Alycia M.

description: This rating is for service.  Customer is always right, so when I tell you I have allergies and what you serve is different from what's listed as ingredients on the menu, don't give me an attitude!!!  It's too bad because this has so much potential to be a great sushi place for an up and coming neighborhood.  I'll continue to go to Noe Valley and elsewhere in the city until Ingleside finally gets a good sushi place.
author: B J.

description:
Called for delivery tonight.  They promised 45 minutes; food arrived 70 minutes later and everything that was supposed to be hot was cold.  Sushi rice is gummy and clumped together.  

Sushi Raw is more expensive but way better.
author: smrt O.

description: All the rolls look the same and taste the same, like crap. Fleas around the place and in the sushi. If you ever have had quality sushi you will hate this place. Avoid this disgusting place or you will be sorry.
author: H G.

description: It's very bad service!i dined in here! I wait almost 35mins can get my sushi.i asked my status.nobody serve me!its very suck!dont order in here! It will let u become angry!
author: Fujo T.

description: Slow delivery guy don t even speak english, never want to give me my change i order $30.45 i gave him $40 n i ask $4 back so i can tip him $5 but he told me that he don t have change omg everytime  if u want to order from them make sure pay by card don t pay cash!!!!!!!!!
author: Daniel C.

description:
It has to be a violation of some sacred japanese right if you say you  have shrimp tempura on your menu but instead you serve me fried shrimp that looks like it came off the hot bar at Sizzler. The rolls all tasted the same and nothing was fresh.

The other reasons I wont be going back : rice was too sweet, poor service, and terriyaki that tasted like a frozen dinner  for a grand total for 2 people of $55?!?!?!?!  It seems there are a lot or regulars here but I cant seem to figure out why....
author: M K.

description: Just ordered from this restaurant today and it was very disappointing. The ramen came already put inside the soup and was extremely soggy. The pork was alright but the soup was flavorless. I also got the baked mussels which were pretty good, but it came pretty cold. The miso scallops were terrible. I was actually expecting more than 2 small scallops drenched in a watery miso soup. I could barely eat any of it since everything was so bad. Don't order from here, especially if you don't want late food.
author: Kyle C.

description: Probably the only sushi place near my house, so I've been here a couple of times, gotten their delivery a few times as well.  Free delivery for $25+ I believe.. at least from 2008-2010 it was. Decent price for okay food.  I always get unagi.
author: Alyssa Z.

description: Disgusting! Some of the worst sushi I've ever had, and I'm not even being dramatic. Yellow tail was not yellow tail. Uni was not fresh. Amaebi head was nowhere to be found. Scallops were not the giant ones used for hotate. Sushi rice was poorly made. Terrible through and through. Rip-off.
author: Antoinette S.

description:
This place just opened on June 1st, 2006. It used to be a soul food joint called Miya's Place which was not welcoming when it was open. That has changed! 

The owners of Yama Sushi greet you with smiles and the "Hello My Name Is" name tags mounted on their Japanese service robes - it's a cute touch. The place is not a trendy spot with smart design, a DJ, or themed sake cocktails - yet. In fact they do not have their beer/wine license now but they plan to load up on sake and beer to go with the very generous portions. We ordered a few things from the extensive menu: udon noodles, hand roll, sashimi, dragon roll, and green tea. 

Other than the kitsch fish plate the sashimi came on, the dishes looked and tasted good. VERY fresh fish with good density without being tough. The udon was good but they messed up on an order then dropped the wasabi on the table. It all fits with the "cuteness" of the place and Jeffery behind the sushi bar loves to talk. 

Yama Sushi is a surprise in this neighborhood that has their share of freaks and sketchy characters hanging outside the liquor store at the corner. If you want a beer or wine with your meal you will have to go in this liquor store. There are some above-decent beers and wines that will do just fine for Yama Sushi - but bring your own until July/August when they can sell alcohol. 

There are NOT a lot of sushi options around this area so I hope they keep the quality and portions consistent. A great value! Two people can feast for under $50 including tip. The massive Sashimi Plate is $22 and that is all I should have ordered. Normally that is a starter at most places.
author: James T.

description:
This was my neighborhood sushi place. Was. No more. Tonight, I gave them one more chance and they blew it. 

Their food is not the most disgusting I've ever had, some of it is tasty, some - tasteless. I've never actually eaten in the restaurant so I can't speak about the service, but almost every time we get takeout, we have to wait way past the time they said our food would be ready.

Their big failing is that not a single time, never ever have they gotten our order completely right. I have some food allergies and I do ask for one or two things to be left out, but I have gotten the wrong items, the items I'm allergic to, and other ridiculously wrong food. 

I don't think that there is a language barrier that prevents me from getting what I want, it must be something else. Whatever it is, they will no longer have my business. I'd rather drive or wait longer for delivery from elsewhere than risk death again.
author: Lina B.

description: One of the places I would consider dining by myself at. Service isn't always up to par and they're super slow with the rolls, but it's close to home. I do love their hot tea, crunchy roll, and bento boxes. Rolls are smaller and pricey for what it is, but I guess it'll do in the mean time. Meh.
author: Ci- Ci H.

description:
I went here on a recommendation from a friend. Not my thing. 

Pros:
Somewhat cheap.

Cons:
Atmosphere: sort of cluttered and ramshackle for my taste. I am used to sushi places being pretty clean and clutter free in terms of the kitchen area, but not this place. 
Also, the  whole wait staff took their dinner break while we were there at. 6:30.  There were six customers and then four or five staff all around us. I don't mind that they did that per se, but the fact is these ladies had some nasty table manners. One girl was talking with food in her mouth and chewing with her mouth wide open the whole time. Her companion, who was the sushi chef, was actually spitting little bones onto the table on a napkin and leaving them there. Behind me, one was smacking her food like she was chewing on a whole pack of gum. Now, I'll be the first to admit that I am somewhat grossed out by watching strangers eat in general, but this was just too much. I was a server myself and I remember taking quick meal breaks in a corner of the dining room. But this felt like I was the one who was interrupting, and mostly I hate bad table manners.  The sushi chef was also scratching her head and then looking to see what she found while she ate. I kid you not. But then, when she went back on shift, I saw that she was at least wearing gloves, so there's that. 

Food: Blandest Miso soup. Okay salad and rolls. Not the freshest fish. Chef Ramsey would have a flippin' field day. Health score seems to be at 86, which makes me wonder how bad things were when they were at 68.
author: Carla G.

description: YESSSSSS they have some really bomb rolls, and they have some not chill rolls, I have ordered chicken but it was not cooked thoroughly so I now opt for the green river and the dynamite roll.  Occasionally it's super late and cold, but I just love it so much I don't even care.
author: Natasha T.

description:
First off, I have been to dozens of Japanese restaurants and am extremely picky when it comes to sushi.

I ordered the 3 Amigo and Godzilla roll. As soon as I was served I could tell that their fish wasn't fresh. I enjoyed the Godzilla roll just because of the crunch, but the 3 Amigo tasted like I bought it at a grocery store. The tuna was very light colored (definitely not how it should look), and unfortunately it tasted as bad as it looked. Usually I do not need to use soy sauce for my rolls but these were very bland. I had to lather them with soy sauce and wasabi. 

Happy hour (1-5pm) is nice though...buy one roll get the second half off, 1 pc nigiri for $1, 3 piece roll for $1. But keep in mind that you're paying less for not great quality food. I'd rather splurge for a good quality meal.
author: Kayla I.

description:
It was simply bad. I'm Japanese and I don't consider what they serve as Japanese food. The noddle was in Miso soup!! Which noddle in Japan comes in Miso Soup??????  It wasn't even home made miso soup either!!! It had small cubed tofu like it was from a packet. It was pathetic. They could at least make a VERY SMALL effort to take a trip to J-town or pick up a Japanese cook book to see what's ACTUALLY Japanese food LOOKS LIKE.  It was NOT EVEN CLOSE to what I call Japanese food. It really makes me mad that these places call themselves Japanese restaurants.


Some jerk sent me this reading this review. I leave honest review. I don't use Yelp to FEEL SORRY for places doing no so great.  I do NOT care where it is located. If it's bad, I will write so. If you feel offended by my review, that's where I stand. 

Just a Note     2/2/2010
New!

Alex B.
San Francisco, CA
For your review of: Yama Sushi

Someone is cranky... Maybe you should go back to japan for your very authentic jap food... This is ingleside honey... There's nothing really authentic or gourmet around here... Only honest people trying to make a buck... Sorry you were so desapointed with yama sushi. Next time go to j-town yourself..
author: A O.

description:
I love sushi, and I do get cravings for them often, and Yama Sushi is conveniently located a few blocks away!
But the place is quite meh. Pretty much summed up by "Meh. I've experienced better."

The restaurant has a chill vibe. Usually it's not TOO busy, but it could get the tables full sometimes.

The service is quite meh. There's a lot of young Asian girls working here (and they are pretty!), but they are a bit unfriendly. I don't think I've seen them smile before...

Sushi's are pretty cheap in retrospect. The quality is average if not below average.
I had low expectations anyways, so the place met up to it.
The fish taste "once-frozen," and sometimes it could have bones in it.
I guess you get  what you paid for!

The last two times I've been here, it's been mainly to just drink a few sakes and beers along with some sushi and appetizers. Their sakes are cheaper than some other places in the city, and their beers are priced at $4.50 so at least it's not over priced.

In the end, if you'd like some cheap but meh sushi with some Japanese beer and sake, then this place isn't a bad choice.
I wouldn't go out of my way to drive here from some where else though.
author: Rei O.

description:
Yama's food makes my girly parts tingle!  I ordered the Unagi Don and the 3 Amigos Roll.  I was extremely satisfied with both choices.
