The Unagi Don was just as expected with no surprises (a good thing), although it was a little bit too sweet.  The 3 Amigos Roll was what hit the spot and made Yama Sushi a winner for me.  The raw fish on that roll looked and tasted so so so fresh!  

The prices are decent...about the same as you would expect, but I think you are getting more than what you pay for in terms of quality.

A plus about this place is that they have GOOD WATER.  I am VERY picky about my water.  If it has that tap taste, I cannot drink it at all.  And you will drink A LOT of their water because it is extremely hot in the restaurant.  No AC at all!  But that complaint went away as soon as the food came out and distracted us all. =)

I will definitely want to eat here again the next time I visit my friend.
author: Zee W.

description: Been coming here since they first opened for their beef noodle udon but I am fed up and have had it. Slowly but surely they have removed specific items from the dish where it is now almost unrecognizable compared to the original. First the sea weed is gone, then the half hard boiled egg, then the fish cake, finally the enoki mushrooms.  The straw that broke the camel's back for me is that I specifically asked to have mushroom and fish cake upon ordering and I get the same stripped down version of what use to be a great soup. I'm done and never going back.  Furthermore, the staff tried telling me those items were never included. That comment is insulting. Liars.
author: Mike J.

description: Great place. Good sushi! Fresh, friendly and convenient. Ask for Yan.  Try their albacore hand roll with soy paper.
author: Arsen B.

description: I have been a customer for more than 5 years, always delivered promptly and food is delicious. I also have eaten in the restaurant and service is on point.  Aside from that, one night I was walking past and it was already closed my phone died and I was locked out of my home (I live nearby) the only remaining staff inside gave me tea and let me use there phone. Despite the fact that they had been closed for some time. They didn't even know I was a loyal customer. These people have integrity and awesome bento boxes! Aside from being great people there food is helllllla good! Love them and highly recommend for a chill neighborhood spot!!!
author: Bella V.

description:
I have been going here for a while now and am pleased to say that the service, quality (for a Japanese restaurant run by Chinese people), and consistency is wonderful here! My bf and I always order the "Happy Bento Box" with Chicken Teriyaki (Smoky flavored!), Short Ribs (could be better, but very flavorful), and Veggie Tempura.

I don't believe this place offers authentic Japanese food, nor did they ever claim to, but I can guarantee you will get the extra bang for your buck here.

The Veggie Tempura is magical! I swear they add something in the tempura batter to make it taste so addicting.

The Futomaki roll is a veggie roll with pieces of pickled daikon, diced carrots, tofu and dark shitake mushrooms. DECLICIOUS! My only gripe however is the way they cut the roll. Why are two pieces generally larger than the other 4? I can't seem to grasp the concept.

Small spot. Genuine servers. Good service.
author: Sandra P.

description:
This place is a unknown  secret gem in San Francisco. It's in the Ingleside residential district, so it is away from all the glamour of SF, but does not default in taste. 

The place is always clean, warm, friednly, and economical. Sushi prices start at $1 per piece. On a recent trip, my party of 3 ate well for $25. Can't beat that price. 

You can casually have lunch by yourself or take the whole family crowd. Either way you will love the freshness of the sushi, and or other Ameircan inspired plates.
author: Ana S.

description:
I like them because there sushi is good and delivery time is on time.
never try the raw fish yet but the bake mussel and volcano roll are always great.
author: Andy H.

description:
A very yummy "49er roll" worth ordering!
Miso soup, perfect for dipping the unusually spicy Poke
An average "Crunchy roll" that wasn't so crunchy

Hot Sake= decent
Super clean bathrooms
How would anybody find this place?  It's in the middle of the residential district
I don't know if ill go back again
author: Travis L.

description: This place was always good, but since they changed hands the food is even better. The California roll was huge, great and very low priced. You can go wrong with anything you order here.
author: Laurel Z.

description: The food is mediocre. The service is the problem. We were seated and had to ask 2 times for water which came about 15 minutes after we were seated. We ordered and waited...and waited...and waited...after about an hour we asked about our order. There were 4 of us and one other table with 2 people at it. They were not busy at all. After an hour and 15 minutes after ordering we talked to them again explaining how unacceptable this is. After about an hour and a half we received mediocre food. Not worth waiting for at all. DO NOT COME HERE UNLESS YOU HAVE ALL DAY!
author: Kelly A.

description: This place is pretty gross and the service is terrible. I really wanted to like it because it's right down the street from me but tried it twice now and I have to say stay away. Severs are so busy with their assembly line for delivery that that they can't be bothered to take your order. We sat there for 20 minutes ignored until I finally had to go to the counter and request someone come take our order. Fish is mediocre at best generally really low quality and I had to pound sake just to get it down hoping the alcohol would stop me from getting sick. Only plus is its pretty cheap but tables are sticky there was food on the walls and obviously no pride in anything going on here.  I don't see how anyone is possibly giving this place a high rating
author: Iain B.

description: Kind of dirty, really cheap. You have to decide your priorities before eating here. You get to order nigiris by the one piece, which helps me out because I fear commitment.
author: katherine y.

description: Love this place. Good food , fairly cheep for San Francisco, bento box is a great deal. My only concern is that the service hasn't been the greatest. It would be nice if they acted a little happy to see you especially cause I've been there dozens of times.
author: Eric A.

description: I've used this place for my sushi fix for years. I always order salmon sushi and never go wrong. I've never had it delivered though so I've never experienced less than stellar service. Sure there's a language barrier once in a while but these days when isn't there?
author: Christina S.

description:
A lot of people knock on this place. For me and my friends its a regular jaunt. Its a good couple of blocks away from my place but its the best sushi that's offered to us in Ingelside! Even tho the health score was knocked a good 4 months ago its better to say the least. The restaurant is the longest lasting restaurant on this corner is a loooooong time. 
I've lived in Ingelside my whole life and went to school down the street from Yama (years and years ago before the Cool Guys market even existed).. 
Sushi is good, but the best deal is the 2 entree bento box. If you come here for sushi, head farther down Holloway and hit 19th up to Geary.. This is strickly a place to get a decent bento dinner and some sub par sushi.
author: Eric A.

description: Food was alright, I was a little surprised by the chicken curry as it was mostly just chicken drizzled with light curry sauce, but maybe I am just not too familiar with japanese curry. The service was so-so as well, as there was only one other party seated in the restaurant when we walked in yet it took a long time for the waitress to even come over and ask about drinks despite the fact that she seated us when we walked in. My boyfriend received his food in an ok amount of time, but mine arrived much later and he was practically done with his by the time it came. We also didn't receive water or napkins until half way through our meal.
author: Mary C.

description: Ive walked by this place a million times on my way to the gym, the sushi is actually pretty cheap and in my experience with sushi you usually get what you pay for but this place was surprisingly delicious. I ordered the dragon roll and the spicy tuna roll, give this place a shot :)
author: Priscilla L.

description: I've had good experiences here and not so great; the main reason I keep going back is because its close to my house. At its best Yama is ultra convenient and tasty sushi that everyone can enjoy. At its worst you sit there for a half an hour after your order for pick up should have been made while they inform you that they don't actually have the ingredients to make you any of the Vegetarian specialties you ordered (which there are very few of) Bonus if you have to turn around and walk back to tell them they didn't pack your sake. I would be much more fond of this place if they showed more love to Vegetarians but its good and its close.
author: Not A.

description: Updating my review to give them one more star.  As time has gone on, I've found myself there a few more times and the food has been pretty solid and the service has improved.  Keep it up Yama!
author: Tamara N.

description: I usually get my ramen fix from Sushi Raw but they open late today so I tried Yama Sushi. I got the duck ramen and a dragon roll. The ramen was awful...barely any meat or veggies, the meat was tough, and the noodles weren't cooked properly. I'm no cook, but I've made ramen before and done a better job. I'll stick with Sushi Raw next time : (
author: Egon S.

description: I just ordered beef sukiyaki and i got beef teriyaki. I called and they said it is definitely sukiyaki but it was beef teriyaki!!!!! :(
author: Hyunha K.

description: I've come by here a few times. The food is decent. I usually get the bento box, 3 items, soup and salad. The service is terrible. It seems like every waitress is in training each time I come in. They seem to stand around in groups behind the counter waiting for the customers to flag them down.
author: Adelina W.

description:
I moved into this area for about two months now and had seen this place while driving by. Although never having the chance to go due to my schedule I finally found the time to go last night! I walked in asking for a to go menu and the three waitresses looked at me as if I was a alien! Fine, provably they were surprised. So I left with the menu and also asked before hand if they would deliver if I lived about less than 2 blocks away. They said yes! Because of this I'll give them another star. I had a stomach ache the whole day and I really needed food. So I ordered a sashimi appetizer (which I regret paying for even though it was only 7 bucks), a philly roll (it came in smoke samon but upon my request to change it to raw I had to add 50cents which is still a good price! Although no avocado), a Alaska roll (nothing of a wow) and a oyaka don (seemed like a Chinese dish more than a Japanese dish. This I will not order again) came to a total of 27 bucks? + tip. Expensive for something I didn't finish and tasted bad. 

First of all the sashimi was... Not fresh and warm. I had a stomach ache the whole day and was debating if I should throw it out to keep eating. Enough said. My favorite of all time is a Philly roll, and theirs were not a wow but it was okay for something that cost about 5 bucks. Although it doesn't have avocado which is a minus. The Alaska roll! Nothing of a wow but it was alright, just alright. The oyako don? Horrible. 

My lesson learned, go elsewhere if I'm really looking for authentic Japanese food. But Yama is a pretty chill place, I will consider going back. 

First star: they have Philly roll for 5 bucks, yum cream cheese!
Second star: they deliver to my house! 2 blocks away! I dislike walking
Third star: because I've yet to try the happy hour! Will go back sooner or later to try their happy hour and will also see if this post need any revising.
author: Vivian H.

description: I'm hooked on this place. Had one of the best meals, period! that I have ever had. My frame of reference for sushi restuarants is limited but every single item we ordered was tasty and fresh. It was so good that after we finished what we had ordered, we ordered more!!
author: Matt V.

description: Great clam soup clean and tasty +1 star, something that you don't see often on menus. Sushi was avg but not to bad for the price. Service was good. Cozy environment smack middle of an neighborhood. Quite nice place to take on a 2nd date or an close friend!
author: Tony L.

description: I love this place. The fish always tastes super fresh. Their hospitality is always welcome, so I go here often. They recently added Happy Hour, in which you can get really tasty rolls for reduced prices. They also deliver, so if you don't feel like getting out of the house you can still enjoy the awesome sushi.
author: Genevieve S.

description: My family and I, we're always here until their food started becoming unfresh and we could taste the fishy gooey taste. I'll still give it 2-stars for being our favorite once before!!!
author: Foodie F.

description:
There are two hair salons where you can get your hair "cornrowed," or braided or "done", you can buy some flowers at the Flower Shop and you can eat sushi -- all on the same block. 

Parking is plentiful and the K line runs a block away from Kama Sushi.

This place is consistent. I like their fresh nigiri - sake & hamachi, bento boxes and sushi rolls.

Their dragon roll, caterpillar rolls and other various rolls are big and filled with fresh ingredients. The fish here is always fresh. Things to pick out when ordering your bento boxes are definitely their finger-lickin' short ribs, gyoza, sashimi, and tempura. 

The staff here is super nice & efficient. Their prices are affordable - which is perfect for all the SF State and City College students. 

And yes, this place is a Japanese joint run by the Chinese [holla!] - I was a little skeptical at first, but this place does it right.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
You know when you are really, really hungry and have a craving for a particular type of food, and then it is SOOOOO delicious?  This place will disappoint you even under these seemingly fool-proof circumstances.  The food is terrible, absolutely the worst so-called Japanese food I have ever had.

I happen to live nearby, and I started eating here soon after they opened. I was so happy to have a little sushi place just a few blocks away.  I remember they had not yet worked out the decor when I first ate here.  I ordered a big bowl of udon noodle soup. And I actually spit it out. It was flavored with Chinese bouillon.  It was so unexpected and so horrible at the same time.  Do you remember when you were a kid and your friend gave you a stick of "trick" hot pepper chewing gum.  It was sort of like that.  I couldn't eat it.  Well, I talked to the chef and explained how seeing as how it was a Japanese restaurant, they ought to be serving up Japanese flavored things.

So, I figured they had just opened. Give them a little time. I came back again and the food was just as bad.  I got some sushi, and it actually made me ill.  The fish had gone off. Totally unacceptable.

Anyway, the place was right on my way home, and I am kind of a slow learner, so I kept going back.  Each time the food was horrible.  Finally, after talking to the chef on numerous occasions about Japanese food, freshness and quality of fish, health code violations, etc. I just gave up.

I am always surprised to drive by here and see it busy.  I guess it is because it is the ONLY sushi place in the area, and some people have cast-iron stomachs and no taste buds.

DO NOT go here if you know anything about Japanese food or if you want freshly prepared, flavorful food.  If your soul has died, and you are simply trying to fill your belly with Chinese-American re-heated junk, okay, eat here.
author: Adrian B.

description:
This restaurant is right by my house, and I have been craving sushi forever, so Saturday got take out. We called it it, and 15 minutes later, it was ready to be picked up. The nigri sushi combo I got was very good, the miso soup tasted like miso soup, but the goyzas were the star. Very flavorful. My little sister liked her California roll too. 
This isn't the best sushi ever, but it is very good, and RIGHT near my house, so this is perfect for a quick fix!  BTW, though I haven't  been inside this restaurant, I have driven by it many, many timees.  It is wheelchair accessible, but is also a pretty small place.
author: Sascha B.

description: I work with clients so I have to plan my lunch accordingly. I ordered a baked scallop roll and a California hand roll. I chose these items because I am pregnant and cannot eat raw fish. My food arrived just on time between clients. I opened the box and had a bite of the baked scallop roll... Raw and cold. Completely raw. Being that my California roll was in the same box, the raw juices from the scallops were soaking the rice. I called and told the lady on the phone that my baked scallop was raw. She said its supposed to be raw. I said no its supposed to be baked. I also told her that my California roll was now contaminated and she said no, California rolls aren't raw. I let her know that it was contaminated by the raw scallop juices. She told me she could offer me a discount on my next offer... Uh what about my food now? I need to eat, my next client is about to come in, and my unborn child has just had raw fish.
author: G Y.

description:
After a disastrous attempt to make sushi at home, my friend and I hopped into my car and drove to the nearest sushi place yelp lead us to. Low and behold there was a sushi place in my neighborhood less than a mile away.

I was a bit skeptical, it was empty and quiet when we entered. My skepticism quickly went away after I looked at the menu. The food was extremely cheap. Cheap and 5 blocks away from my house, too good to be true?

We ordered 3 or 4 rolls off the menu along with some nigiri. I really liked how the nigiri was just one piece instead of 2. It gave me room to try a lot more different kinds and they were all under $2! The sushi here did not impress me. They were moderately sized but there was nothing special to them. Nothing bad either. It was all just ok sushi with really great prices. The service was friendly and fast. I think it's because we were the only people there.

I'd definitely come back to this place, but all for the wrong reasons. I'd be showing up merely because it's 5 blocks from my house and everything is under $7. It would be like my local fast food joint, except in sushi form. I can see an addiction forming, I may not even get out of my pajamas to go next time.
author: Michelle N.

description: Ordered the Yama Bento Box with Gyoza, Shrimp Tempura, and Saba Shioyaki for delivery from Seamless. Food was okay, although I do want to point out that there was only one piece of shrimp in my shrimp tempura and the rest were vegetables. (Sad face.) Delivery was on-time (1 hour). Delivery guy was really nice. This might possibly become my new Japanese take-out place.
author: Virulpat W.

description: I really like the sushi here. Service is pretty decent but no matter what you get , it usually taste pretty good. I never really was a sushi lover but I'm starting to see why people like it.
author: Parveen S.

description: Yama sushi is convenient if you live in ingleside cause of its residential location. Thats a plus. I love getting donburi's and yama did not deliver on that dish. The beef was stringy and fatty. The chicken donburi had a fishy after taste that ruined it. Have only tried the spicy tuna hand roll and that was pretty good. But the entrees were very disappointing.
author: Josh Y.

description:
I also feel slightly guilty for not reviewing Yama, just like Morgan Ashley ( Hi!!! =p ). Morgan is actually the one who introduced me to Yama Sushi and since that fateful day, I have been hooked.

My boyfriend and I come here probably once a month (sometimes twice if we missed last month!) and we always order the same thing! I know, I know, try something new you say, but I am always satisfied with my meal, so why change it? 

My order - Bento Box, consisting of: Teriyaki Chicken, Vegetable Tempura, & Gyoza. Everything is always tasty and delicious. I also love how the waitresses never give me the stink-eye for substituting. (I am not a shrimp lover, so I always order all vegetable tempura.)

The BF's order - 1 Philadelphia roll & 1 Spicy Volcano roll. (Also, my left overs, if I haven't gobbled everything up already.) Now, I'm not a sushi fan, but have tried both of these rolls and they are quite delectable. 

I always, ALWAYS, end my meal with Fried Banana with Vanilla Ice Cream. There's really nothing to say about it, except that it is scrumptious.

The only negatives are: parking is scarce most of the time and the service can be a little bit slow if you dine here at their peak hours.
author: Chloe C.

description:
The gyoza at this place are amazing! Really nice tasting (made of chicken, not pork) and they're always really hot.  The wait staff are pretty attentive; always refilling hot green tea. I would recommend the chicken katsu, teriyaki chicken and beef, and the GYOZA :)

I've definitely had better ramen though. The service takes a little while, and they're a tad bit pricey.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
First off it's a family owned, neighborhood restaurant so it's definitely worth supporting.  

PROS:
- The sushi is good.  It isn't great but it's good and it's reasonably priced. 
- Parking is easy as it's in a hidden neighborhood area
- I haven't had to wait for a table yet 
- The people are all very nice.  The service is a bit hit or miss.  The servers seem nice and they genuinely want to provide great service but somehow the orders don't always come out right and they tend to come out at different times
- They deliver

AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- The service can be a bit hit or miss
- The atmosphere isn't particularly inviting.  Some of my favorite sushi restaurants don't have the best atmosphere, but if the sushi isn't phenomenal, a little more ambience would help
- As a small restaurant they only have so much capacity but they seem to take more orders than they can efficiently handle.  There are not a lot of customers in the restaurant but the issue seems to be when the staff and the kitchen are also preparing a lot of take out orders.
author: Cantik E.

description:
This is another place that's nice to have in the neighborhood.  We're regulars at Ebisu and, for a while, we started going to Kamakura on Ocean instead.  But on three separate occasions, one or more of us got sick at Kamakura, so we stopped going.

We just got back from Yama.  The prices are great for what get and some of the dishes are pretty tasty, particularly the house salad and the sunumono.  The quality of the fish is mixed, as you might expect for the price.  The hamachi on our rolls was excellent, but the piece on the nigiri was a little old.  I had one piece of very good unagi and another that was so fatty that I gagged.  

The atmosphere is not much to speak of. It's small (Occupancy 34).  They pump the radio through the speaker at low volume.  It's got kind of a dressed up diner feel with some tacky Japanese flair thrown in.

This is a good, not great, sushi place.  We will go back there because we can walk there.  If you are feeling like sushi, don't want to spend too much and are tired of We Be, it's a good, slightly pricier, alternative.
author: John G.

description: I have been a regular Yama customer for a number of years. It's never been the best food, but they deliver and it's been fine for lunch ... until now. About a month ago, I ordered some sushi and two seaweed salads. When the food arrived, the salads were yellow (not green as they should be) and smelled bad. They were not edible. I called and spoke with a woman on the phone. I had paid cash and she offered to give me a credit for the salads the next time I ordered. Frankly, they should have given me a free meal (delivering bad food is dangerous and just bad business). But having been a regular customer for so long, I felt it was fine to cut them some slack. My mistake. When I made my next order, there was no "record" of the credit and rather than take my word for it (a long time customer) they refused to give me credit for the bad food that they delivered. It was my mistake to order from them again. Clearly, they don't care about the quality of their food, or the experience of their customers. Go anywhere but this place!
author: Laura C.

description:
Raw: 3.5 stars; Cooked: 2 stars.

That noted, I am very excited that we now have a sushi restaurant in my neighborhood.  If you saw this neighborhood when we moved in years ago, you would not think to yourself "Great spot for a sushi restaurant!"  But in fact, that is exactly what we needed to round out the businesses on this tiny block.

Because I am a raw fish lover, and the husband is not, this becomes yet another He Said, She Said review.  Because I am writing it, She Said goes first.

She Said:
Fried Uni Appetizer - very good, 4 pieces of uni.  Batter a little heavy.
Hirame Sashimi - (halibut) - excellent, fresh, translucent fish. Generous portion.
Red Dragon Roll - (tempura shrimp, rice, crab salad, avocado, tobiko) - pretty roll, huge portion.  Pretty good. A little heavy on the rice.
Salmon/Cream Cheese Roll - OK.

He Said:
Tempura appetizer - very heavy, breading should be much lighter.  
Cucumber/Cream Cheese Roll with Soy Paper - OK
Sweet/Sour Chicken - not very good.  Way too heavily battered and then overcooked so it was difficult to eat (too hard/crunchy).

They Said:
Tea - not that good!   Bland.  Way too hot.  Sad.
Edamame - OK, nicely salted

Service was nice & friendly and this place is new, so we'll try it again.  Plus the location is convenient, the prices are reasonable and the place seemed very clean.  

When our server came by at the end of the meal and asked if everything was OK, I was able to answer honestly and say "Yes.  Everything was OK."  No more, no less.
author: Liz S.

description:
Not bad. 3.5 stars. Of course, this review is based on their sushi because that's all we ordered. It's a small yet comfortable size restaurant; very high ceiling and large windows.  However, they should purchase new window treatments that actually fit the window size. I know, not important, but things like that stick out to me. The location isn't that bad either, although it probably can be on the wrong day.  Anyways, here's the 411 on our rolls:

49er: Love it! The fish was fresh and marinated tastefully. I liked the fish on top (I think it was tuna) with the avocado.
Volcano: Similar to a Lion King roll, but without the mayo sauce on top. Warm and tasty, but the salmon on top was a little dry.
Super California: Just your typical California roll with avocado on top that didn't wow me in any way, but it wasn't nasty either.
Spicy tuna: Good and mildly spicy, probably could've "kicked it up a notch."

It was great to eat sushi at a place that knows how to cook their rice; it was light and fluffy vs. very hard and unappealing to my mouth. We also ordered the Poke (raw tuna marinated with sauce) which was also very tasty. I think I could probably make it myself because the "secret" ingredients tasted like soy sauce, sriracha (Asian hot sauce), and sesame oil.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Yay! A sushi place in the hood. Ok, so it's not mindblowing, but it's fine and perfect as a local sushi spot. It's small, the food is good, they have highchairs for babies, the service is fine. 

1. The mussel appetizer is yummy.
2. They serve sushi by the piece instead of in pairs, which I kinda like because 10 pieces is too much, but 7 feels just right. 
3. The softshell crab roll is delish
4. I wouldn't order the bbq ribs again, not that it was bad, but I'd rather try something new.

Will definitely be back for more!
author: joanna c.

description: i have had food delivered to my house from this restaurant several times now and even tho I asked them to not put wasabi in my food, they keep doing it. i usually don't care and just take the part mixed with wasabi off but today i got the wasabi all mixed up with everything... it seemed like the person who cooked it or the driver who delivered my lunch played soccer with it and it was all a disaster... I'm not eating lunch today and i don't even care about calling them to complain... I'm just not getting any food from them anymore. Total disappointment.
author: K. Y.

description:
Finally, a Japanese restaurant near me! 
It's not the best but it's also not the worst. When i've got a hankerin' for some sushi and I don't feel like trekking it elsewhere, Yama is the place I go. 
The first time I went, I went with my cousin. We both ordered bento dinner combos. They were under $10. 
Did you read that?! Bento box dinners for $10! That's cheap. 
I had salmon teriyaki and some maguro sashimi. My salmon was perfect,  tasted very fresh and the sauce was good. Not too salty, not too sweet.. 
The two of us split that fried potato appetizer. It menu said 4 pieces so we thought "yea that should be enough for the both of us" but it was really just 1 piece cut into fours. Watch out for stuff like that. The waitresses here are very nice though. 
I was satisfied by the portions here, but my cop friend thought it was a little on the small side. 
The second time I dropped by , I ordered  to go. They have sushi combination platters for very very cheap. I forget what letter combo I ordered but everything was decent but it wasn't phenomenal. 
I ordered a spicy tuna hand roll on the side and I remember I did not like it at all! I watched the owner's wife make it and I saw her squirt in Sriracha (mmmm) but when I ate it, it tasted mostly like mayonnaise. I know that most places mix Sriracha with mayo to make their house spicy sauce but this was ridiculous. It wasn't the least bit spicy!


If you're a sushi snob, don't come here.
If you have problems with Japanese restaurants being Chinese owned and operated, don't come here.

Otherwise, welcome to my neighborhood Japanese restaurant..
author: Susy C.

description:
Who'd thunk that this little ma-pa sushi house in the heart of the hood would have such great, high quality sushi?  Given the quality of most restaurants in my neighborhood, my hopes weren't too high.

The service rocked.  The quality of fish was great.  The selection was excellent --and I can't wait to come back and try at least a dozen other things that were on the menu.  

I am definitely delighted and impressed!
author: Amy A.

description:
Its good.  The neighborhood is fine - there werent shady characters or anything hanging out - for that drive further down Holloway to my block and you'll see.... And if it were, the entertainment from the large windows might be a draw. Who doesn't want to watch a virtual hair show as the freshly shorn from the barbers strut down the block? Go next door and get your hair braided. And as your eyes tear from the pain you can blame it on wasabi. Yep. Three hours of sushi fun.

The rolls were cheap, sufficient. I tried one of those baked rolls and it tasted good even though it wasnt what I expected. It was rich and if I feel like eating it again I wouldn't order anything else.

As an addict of variety, I like the 1-piece Nigiri options too. It might not be as aesthetically pleasant, but you can't take sushi home for later.

My Una-Temp didn't have much Unagi in it. But it was like 4 bucks.

Dont order beef teriyaki - it was like fried flank steak with sauce thrown on it.

I like that there's a Japanese restaurant among the many many many many many Chinese restaurants on this Ocean-Ingleside side. Can I request  a local Thai restaurant too?
author: Cheryl D.

description:
Pretty good neighborhood place.
Makis where good and inexpensive.
The hamachi kama is perfectly grilled.
I'm going to try the tempura next time I go.
author: Geordie E.

description:
notttt bad. 

"if you're really craving some good Japanese food, go somewhere else. But if you're in the Ingleside area and feeling lazy, go here."

(totally stole that from some one else. but i couldnt have said it better myself.)

i tried a few sushi rolls and an order of uni. rolls were ok. not great, not bad. a little too  much rice, but not enough to never come back. uni was also ok. not the freshest, but it also wasnt bad (yet.)

i still want to come back and try their happy hour that everyone seems to be raving about
author: Lisa N.

description: This'll be short and sweet. The sushi's good, not amazing, but definitely good enough for repeat business. The service isn't the best, but tolerable. The first experience was really bad when the waitress spilled a cup of water into one of our rolls and didn't really do anything about it, but every experience since then has been an improvement.
author: Nate P.

description:
So I feel slightly guilty for not having reviewed this place despite being a regular for the past two or so years. Only when I moved out here to New York did I realize how spoiled I was for having Yama Sushi right by my house.

1) Their California Rolls use legit crab. We've all probably grabbed one of those plastic to-go trays from the mall food court, or out of Safeway, only to be disappointed at the way the imitation crab left you wanting more. That issue does not exist here. Boy are their California Rolls delish.

2) The green tea ice cream is the best I have ever (and may ever!) have. While I am no ice cream connoisseur, I know that the fact I can taste the swirl of the caramelized sugar crystals means they make this homemade. When I went to school around the block, I'd often come here just to get the ice cream as an afternoon snack. Their fried bananas also do not disappoint. Tempura + fruit = my fave.

3) The service, though sometimes slow, is always fantastic. The shy little girls who probably go to State are always very sweet and polite. And because my family and I come here so often (you'd think we have a tab here), the owner never fails to greet us, even if it is at the Balboa Bart Station.

4) It's inexpensive. And as I mentioned earlier, now that I'm in New York, I know just how high people will rack up their prices, despite having only mediocre sushi.

The only downside (and deduction of a star) comes from the fact that parking is a pain, and the service can be slow on a hectic night.

Jeez I can't way to go home! ;)
author: Morgan Ashley C.

description:
This place is right in my unassuming neck of the woods, and I have to say I'm happy to have it nearby. The dishes are a really reasonable price for Japanese fare, and I've never been disappointed by the sashimi or other dishes. I typically get a spider hand-roll (Crispy, Hot, Crabby, and Cheap!) and the chirashi or udon, and leave with a very happy belly for under $20. The miso that I had here this week was very tasty, with a good rich flavor. Tons of umami. 
As far as authenticity goes; I've had their natto-maki (stinky fermented soybeans). I haven't seen natto dishes at very many other sushi joints around town (can only recall one or two), so that should say something.
author: Blake L.

description: Let me begin with a one-sentence positive highlight of my lunch: the bit-expensive, eight-piece dragon roll was good as well as the miso soup that comes with the entrees and bento boxes. Now with the not-so-great. The chicken karaaage had an aftertaste as if the chicken, batter or the oil used to deep-fry was old. It was also not authentic: the chicken is supposed to be marinated and then coated in potato starch (or substituted with cornstarch), not have a shell of wet batter (which means chicken dipped in egg wash and then floured). Upside: good amount of dark meat sans the fat. My mom got the bento box and there was something wrong with each item: the tempura batter was bland and underseasoned, and it didn't come with tempura sauce; used dry chicken breast for the teriyaki; beef teriyaki wasn't sliced thin and the meat tasted closer to a roast beef; and the broccoli, although still crunchy, was old and showed yellow sprouts. The dressing for their salad was weird -- it wasn't thousand-island style nor was it like a vinaigrette. So there are definitely better options to choose from other than Yama Sushi if you have a craving for Japanese.
author: Cliff W.

description: Love this place. Vegetarian friendly, they deliver, and they're open late-ish. Food is good, reasonable priced, and overall awesome! I only took off a star for the minimum delivery charge of $15
author: C L.

description:
I go to Yama at least once a month and have had very few complaints.  Out of the, oh lets say, 30 times I've been here the food has always been good, I've not received something I ordered once (and once I pointed out that it was still on the bill, they fixed it and apologized immediately), and occasionally they are a little slow, particularly with the bill.  

I'm picky with my sushi, but not ultra-picky.  I like Yama's food a lot.  The miso is nothing amazing, but it's fine, and the fish has always been fresh, which is my main point of contention when it comes to sushi.  My brother, however, is an elitist pain in the ass.  He thinks Yama is excellent. He does not give compliments easily.

Added to all that, the prices are excellent, especially if you go for happy hour, which is every day, which is amazing.

Regarding Megan K's review, I am surprised about the shrimp tempura.  Very.  The soft shell crab I will admit I do not order because it is consistently way overdone, but the shrimp tempura has always been just right for me. Very odd.
author: Jenna C.

description: Above average sushi, delivery took about an hour. I had the 49er roll which was phenomenal, the miso soup which was pretty standard and the fried bananas that were good, not great. Tried a couple bites of my friends rolls and they were exceptional as well. 8/10 would def recommend
author: Brian W.

description:
By far, the best japanese restaurant in the city!

Sushis are super delicious. Tempuras are extra tasty without too much fattening oil that most other restaurants use. The udon noodles are great. Everything I've tried so far is goooood.

It's in an ugly neighborhood but it's worth it go. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants.
author: Milz T.

description: My friend from la came to sf and we looked up this place! It was great , everything was good and hot. Its a small place but dont let that stop you from going in and getting some good food!!!
author: Tyra C.

description:
Definitely a nice hole in the wall in the middle of Holloway in the Ingleside.  Not exactly the safest neighborhood (we saw like 4 cop cars in the area while eating...) but worth going to just for the price and food.

Came here with the BF this week and ordered a few rolls and the soup.  The rolls are in served in big portions, a bit too much rice but they also put a lot of fish in it, pretty good but the soup... mmm the soup was really good!  BF says the fish were pretty fresh too. Relatively cheaper prices than other sushi places.  

By observation, a lot of folks came by to order take out and there was a good number of people eating in as well.  

Service and food was good, we'd definitely will be coming back here.
author: Natalie G.

description:
The decor here felt cheap and it looked like it used to be a bar.  I came here a few times craving sushi.  I always get the bento box and my boyfriend gets a different dish every time. This place isn't very good particularly.  Everything just tastes like chinese food to me, well the cook IS chinese after all.  But it just doesn't have the taste of authenticity and though the portions are quite big here, its just not my cup of tea

Eat here if you want food that isn't fresh.  While you're eating here, you can hear your food being heated up, like the sound of the beeps or the even more distinct sound of the opening and closing of the microwave.
.
author: Joyce C.

description:
When I first noticed there was a sushi place on Holloway I said "What the hell is a sushi place doing on Holloway?!?".  Then I tried the sushi.

Well, not  bad at all.  My first meal was a dragon roll with ton katsu (and probably something else which I don't recall at the moment).  Boy was I surprised when the sushi came.  For a japanese restaurant, these are not small portions.  It's a good thing this was asian cuisine or I would never have had the will to eat it all.

How good was the sushi?  Well, I'm pretty picky about my sushi, and I have to say it was more than acceptable.  I only give it three stars because of the meteoric heights to which sushi can rise (which this restaurant does not reach).  But for the price, I could come here every day!  The atmosphere is very relaxed as well- too bad the large windows are wasted on a view of Holloway.

Anything you get on the menu will be to your satisfaction and the service couldn't be better.  Basically, a good spot for the locals but don't make the trip if you don't live within walking distance- you might as well go to a fancy schmancy sushi house for all the trouble of transportation.

And don't forget to try the ramen!
author: Nicolas M.

description:
Good Service
Decent Prices
Good Sushi

So far I've come here about 6 times. It has yet to disappoint me. My favorite is the bay scallops and volcano rolls. 

The service quick,friendly, and attentive. 

We've also had the usual rolls- rainbow, caterpillar, spicy tuna,  and some sashimi.  All of which are decent.

The decor is ok, it's nothing too fancy but the decent food makes up for it.

Parking is actually easy. One thing I'm fascinated about is the fact that their neighbors are all hair salons. There are 5 hair salons lined up right next to them. I guess if you're craving sushi and a perm it's the right neighborhood to be in.
author: Bert T.

description:
Oooh!  Sushi within blocks of my home!  Pinch me.

I don't even care if Chinese people are serving me Japanese food.  Do I care if Mexicans are flipping shrimp at Benihana's?  Good food is good food, dammit.  

Me likey hot tea, sashimi and ginger. All are fresh.

Service is a little spotty, but it's not inattention, it's just shyness.  The girls are young, not mindreaders.

This particular corner has gone thru many hands, and this has been the most successful business yet.  Imagine that, a sushi joint in the Ingleside.  Best kept secret. Mine mine mine!!
author: Sheila G.

description: This is a good little sushi spot that's really close to our apartment. They always accommodating us on our orders and are very friendly.   The sushi quality is OK but there are better options in the city. Would recommend to anyone wanting fast sushi at a good price.
author: Erica J.

description:
I wanted donburi.  We had just worked out at the local 24 hour fitness. My buddy lives near here, so he knew of this Japanese restaurant.

It's different than what I'm used to.  The normal ingredients are there, but there's this sauce that you put on it. I like my donburi a bit 'wet,' but this was pretty dry, except for the sauce you'd put on it. Different, and I don't really know which way is "authentic" or whatever.

Three stars because it was good enoug to come back to when I'm in the area, but not something I'd seek out.
author: Robert L.

description:
I am thankful that this place is located a couple of blocks away from me. Their service was really good, their food was fresh and tasty. They also served rice roasted green tea and put lemons in my water! (I'm sorry I just get really excited about it cause I didn't even have to ask). The Miso soup is really tasty. I'm not much of a soup kind of person, but the soup here was great. 

I'm going back this weekend with my roomates. Their food is yummy.
author: Shereen R.

description:
This is a nice little Japanese place run by Chinese people. I came here one day with the bf and a friend and it was totally empty except for two girls in a corner table. The ambience was not awkward, though. My bf had the beef udon, my friend had a bentoo box, and I had a duck ramen. This ramen was actually quite new to me, for I'd never had duck and soup in the same dish. But it was surprisingly yummy. The skin was crispy, the meat was juicy. When my ramen came it smelled super good and I actually enjoyed it. My bf liked his udon a lot and I think my friend said the bentoo box was alright. 

Overall, this is the closest Japanese restaurant to my house and it's convenient for me. It's yummy and I'm sure anytime I'm craving Japanese but don't want to travel too far, I'll come here. :)
author: M J.

description: This place sucks!  They even have the audacity to charge a high price for this CRAP! OMG
author: Annie A.

description:
First off, as a native of Ingleside, I must say that I'm so pround of Yama Sushi and hope that it has a very long life @ 850 Holloway Avenue. This place has changed businesses in the past 5 years *MANY* times, so it's refreshing to see some stability.

The donburi is very good, although I prefer mine "wet". The bento box is my favorite, and the tea is always hot. The waitresses can be a little ditzy when it comes to service, but I attribute that more to shyness as opposed to the usual "I'm only coming over if you need me" stance taken by servers in many restaurants.

For the price, this is a great investment for students who live in the 'hood and people just passing through. Be alert at night, though, as the beauty salons next door attract a somewhat ghetto clientele. And don't sit by the door on a cold night, because it doesn't shut all the way and the cool blast will chill you to the bone. Just sit back, shut up and eat...
author: Maurice R.

description: So I saw Yama Sushi on Eat24 and decided to order from them. I proceeded to order 3 sushi rolls, miso soup, tonkatsu curry, and gyoza. I waited for an hour and 10 minutes before I realized the delivery was late. After calling the restaurant at about an hour and 20 minutes after ordering they said the food was on the way. At an hour and 45 minutes (25 min laters), I called again. The food arrived 2 hours and 16 minutes after ordering. The sushi was warm having been place under the miso soup, potstickers, and curry. The curry was cold and did not have the tonkatsu that was ordered  the pot stickers and the miso soup were cold as well. Apparently delivery took around 20 minutes because I contacted Eat24 to have them see where the food is. When eat 24 contacted me, they said the delivery had just left about 3-4 minutes before the 2 hour mark. Obviously, the restaurant manager is lying saying that the food had gone out almost an hour before. If it had, why was the sushi not packaged separately from the hot food? Why did the tell eat24 it left 20 minutes before it arrived to my place? How can a restaurant be satisfied sending out poorly prepared food like this?  I don't recommend this place. It's got tawdry customer service, poor food preparation/presentation, and just was utterly disappointing. The only bonus was that the restaurant credited me 30% of the order cost (roughly $19 for $30 in sushi). Eat24 did credit me another $10 for my next meal, but still, waiting 2 and a quarter hours for inedible food does not make sense.
author: James F.

description: I kept passing the place on my way home from the gym and it's always busy so finally gave it a try and they have the best miso soup I've had in a while and the sushi is really good as well. NIce location and parking is easy. Definitely a must to go to if your in the area!!
author: Kathleen P.

description: This place has great food and the prices are great too. I love the vegetable udon. The place is comfortable and non-pretentious. It's a place to go for everyday eating.
author: Palina P.

description:
Very courteous staff and very attentive. The food is good and the service is fast. I think the pricing is about the middle of the road. I would go there again. 

Kind of tough for parking if it's a busy night.
author: Jason R.

description: sush for two has enough for one person and fish was not fresh! Very disappointing...
author: audrey Y.

description: They are okay - they don't blow me away.  They deliver which is nice.  They are pretty cheap.  The delivery guy last night was kind of weird.  I might have made this a four star review but the delivery guy stuck his head closer to me to stare at my belly - maybe to see if I'm pregnant - I don't know.  I guess overall this was a three star experience.
author: Helga B.

description: This place has awesome California rolls and chicken katsu. Not too pricey and recently remodeled. Staff is friendly and food comes quick.
author: Kevin E.

description:
Walked in, got a seat right away.

Menu looked pretty good, and cheap.  The thing that piqued my interest most was the nigiri menu, because they sell singles as opposed to pairs of rolls.  This is good if you are on a budget or need a cheap lunch.  Most of them are $1.00 to $2.00, average $1.50.

I had the nigiri combo (sushi combo E), though, as it had a good selection and i was in a hurry to get some sushi, and i also wanted the miso soup that comes with it.  It cost $8.95 for 8 pieces of nigiri and soup.

Miso came quickly, was good.  The sushi came quickly as well, before i was done with my miso, even.  It was well worth the money.  The fish looks really fresh, and really nice cuts.  The rice is very well-made sushi rice.  The arrangment and plating were very simple, but the meal looked very appetizing, simple yet elegant. 

Hot tea is complimentary, but as has been said before here, it is very, very bland.  It's essentially hot water with a tiny bit of flavor.  I don't really mind that though, just a minor drawback, since they also have a semi-full bar, with sake.

I wish I could have had more to eat, as I LOVE sushi, but it was time for me to leave. 

The interior is small, but doesn't feel crowded.  The waitresses are very good about not bothering you when you're eating, and coming quickly when you aren't eating.

I will be going back here, as it is so close to where I live, and it has good food for a pretty good price.  Check it out.
author: David P.

description: I love to eat here and everytime I have sushi, I compare it to Yama.  I love their fresh fish, this is so important to me because I usually only order sashimi and I like it to be fresh.  The rolls that my buddy orders are really  beautiful and she is always happy.  I think that the service is great and the prices are fair.  I like going here because it used to be a candy store when I was a kid growing up in this neighborhood and it just makes me happy that I am about to put something really good into my mouth.  Finding this spot was a real treat!
author: Jenna J.

description: I hate to flat out blast a place into bits unless they truly deserve it and this place does not because the customer service was fantastic. The food on the other hand not so much and, I reluctantly have to agree with Nobu K's review. Japanese food is one type of food that one should be picky about due to the delicate and potentially dangerous outcome if not prepared properly! I had read Nobu's review but decided to try it anyhow as it is the closest Sushi restaurant in my area. On having read his review my fiance and I decided to opt for cooked options and both got bento boxes. Everything was wrong in the texture and flavor. What a dissapointment! The miso soup was off, the rice was soggy. My beef dish was a pile of thinly sliced fat. Our tempura was overcooked, soggy and the batter was obviously fried in dirty oil. The tempura sauce was overly salted and more like watery soy sauce. The chicken teriyaki was not grilled, it was obviously baked and the teriyaki sauce was watery. The teriyaki salmon was soggy as well, the salmon of poor farmed quality tasting muddy. Even the salad was soggy, the veggies old and the dressing simply thousand island. I will definitely not be going back to even give this place a second chance as, I repeat..... every single dish was off!!! Japanese food is one of my absolute favorite cuisines when prepared properly and this was absolutely not!!
author: Out O.

description:
so I'm no sushi expert - but I remember when I showed the menu to a college friend who's big on sushi he said that there was combinations that he hadn't heard of but sounded really good. Sadly, he never went there because he moved back to Boston soon after.

That was in spring of 2006 soon after they opened. I actually found out about Yama opening because I had a job working with a commercial corridor revitalization project on nearby Ocean Avenue. Residents that I knew in those neighborhoods told me how businesses at the corner where Yama is have always had trouble lasting very long and I'm really happy to hear that it's still around - and people spreading the good word is great. The corner is kind of an odd spot - technically it's the meeting point of 3 neighborhoods - Ingleside Terraces (west - more expensive), Ingleside (east - more towards middle class) and Merced Heights (south of Holloway).

The owner (Jeffrey - in the picture) is extremely nice and so is his staff. Jeffrey wouldn't have it any other way. 

've been there multiple times - it's always great. Simple ambiance with great food and extremely reasonable prices.
author: Emmet M.

description: the food was awesome, except for the bbq eel on bento box which was quite unexpected (the texture was weird), but overall it's just excellent, finding parking will be quite a problem.
author: Darren G.

description: It is wonderful to have a decent japanese place near our home.  my three daughters love the edamame and gyoza.  baked scallops rock and the oyoku don hits the spot.  prices are decent, service is good and the place seems pretty kid friendly.  tough location, so i hope it makes it!
author: Bruce R.

description:
I've lost track of how many times this place has given me and my family the runs. Why do I keep going back? Because the nearest decent sushi restaurant is a 15min drive, whereas Yama Sushi is 1.5 blocks away.

I've tried just about everything on their menu. They seem to use soy sauce in most of their dishes, including the sushi - I rarely taste authentic Japanese flavors. Their donburi and noodle soups are pretty much Chinese-style. The miso soup is bland. I would say the fish is fresh less than half the time.

The prices are average compared to other Japanese restaurants, but a bit high for the quality of food (I am willing to pay this slight premium because if offsets the time and gas I save going to better restaurant). Customer service is better than the typical Asian restaurant.
author: Ruth T.

description: MM! I love me some mediocre sushi in a semi gangster neighborhood!
author: Ms T.

description: I think I just threw up in my mouth a little. Ordered this....about an hour ago on Grubhub. Just got it. Probably the most disgusting sushi I have ever eaten. I couldn't make out what fish I was eating in most of the rolls. The salmon on the Volcano roll was almost all of the brown part of the salmon, you know, the fat/blood filled part. So disgusting. Don't eat here. Ever. I'm not even picky; I will eat grocery store sushi. I ate like 1 piece of each roll and threw it out.
author: Sydni S.

description:
This is my first review, and I don't want the 5 stars to throw any one off who may think that my giving 5 stars on my first review is a sign that I am overly nice. The only reason I signed up for a Yelp account is so that I could write a review for my favorite sushi restaurant. That restaurant is Yama Sushi. So yes, I am giving it 5 stars.

Why do I love Yama Sushi? Here are my top 10 reasons:

1. Best and most fresh Hamachi Sashimi I have ever had. Seriously.
2. Spicy Tuna hand roll. Oh. My. Awesome. (If you are feeling brave order our special little creation, The Scotty Roll - make sure you are hungry!)
3. Some pretty sweet classic Chicago tunes playing in the background. 
4. We are on a first name basis with the owner, Jeff, who always greets us with a smile (maybe he is faking it, but we feel welcome). All the waitresses are very nice.
5. They never judge us for coming in two days in a row. Or three.
6. They never turn us away when we show up at 9:29 PM and they are closing at 9:30 PM.
7. My cup of hot green tea never gets low.
8. Baked Mussels appetizer. I'm drooling on my keyboard. Do it. You will thank me later.
9. We can order fried prawn heads even though they are no longer on the menu.
10. Affordable. (Assuming that, unlike us, you do not order 5 bottles of hot sake and 5 large Asahi beers, whoops)

This is a great spot, never very busy, and it always makes me happy. Enjoy!
author: Jenny R.

description: this place is KILL. i love it great sushi at a fair price they had 12 cali rolls with miso soup for like 6 bucks. I hate miso soup but they had the best i had ever tasted. They had bigger rolls from like 7-10 bucks it was a great place for a date, in the cut, not super busy, and good food for cheap. hope this helped.
author: ronz w.

description:
always a good place to grab some good sushi and teriyaki chicken after studying. the service here is really good, they seem to always be over staff with tons of people standing around, ready to serve you. 

refills your tea with a quickness and food is ready fast too.
author: Jennie L.

description: yummy food. street parking tho (but its SF, what can you do).
author: M l K.

description: This place is absolutely terrific.  This is a nice neighborhood restaurant with a large variety of sushi and cold beer. They are quick,  and very pleasant, but most importantly, they have terrific prices.  If you like sushi, check this place out.  I go once a month and I live eighteen miles away.
author: Chocoolate I.

description:
Food is a little better than OK, prices reasonable, service absolutely adorable and attentive, and compared with the rest of the neighborhood this is the "fancy" restaurant. 

Yama Sushi took over for a BBQ place that was in that space for years. I love soul food, and yet as much as I tried I could either never find the place open or it was open but looked sketchy and uninviting. The Yama mamas took over, painted it up and strung a bunch of knick-knacks around (including over the fire extinguisher!) and the place is really a happening joint now. I don't eat a lot of raw stuff, but the maki I've had has been very passable when the guy makes it, and a few notches down in size and taste when the new girl rolls. Bentos are usually generous portions and tasty enough - the sukiyaki is outstanding, fried stuff is edible but I recommend against it.

The servers are all cute, plentiful and friendly, well-skilled at refilling your green tea so that you can maintain the third-degree burn that you received on your first attempted sips. It's not one of the "best" Chinese-operated Japanese restaurants in the City if based purely on food quality - it probably bounces around "average." But for the surrounding neighborhood choices, plus the attentive and friendly service the food becomes much more delicious and for that I am as generous with the stars as they are with their delightful miso soup.
author: Zen T.

description: I love the location of this place (it being only a few blocks away).  I love the miso as well.  The service was attentive and the speed was adequate.  This place is definitely a "neighborhood" dining experience, like a nice dive bar in comparison to a lounge or a club.
author: Jay M.

description: What a disappointment!  I used to come here regularly and considered it a neighborhood gem.  'Went there last night and it was obvious from the moment I walked in that something had changed.  The place looks run down, the floors needed a good wash & litter picked up, & dead flowers removed from the table.  They were heavily staffed with 6-7 people behind the counter but I was the only customer until half way thru my meal when someone else wandered in.  The food was a big disappointment.  The miso soup was lacking in taste, the bento box was sub-par, greasy tempura, odd tasting chicken teriyaki, sloppily made California rolls.  While I was having my dinner several of the staff were having theirs, standing behind the counter eating their bowls of soup ... very unprofessional.  My waitress confirmed that the restaurant had been taken over from the original management and obviously only the name remains the same.  I won't be going back and suggest you don't waste your money.
author: M F.

description: Great place near SFSU to grab some Japanese food and it's probably the only one in my neighborhood.  Cheap price, fast service.  That's all I got to say.
author: Joanna W.

description: this place is GREAT. i love that it's not that well known and not in a touristy part of the city. the owners are chinese, but they definitely know how to make good sushi. however, i wouldn't get anything besides sushi here--their teryaki, for example, is very average (most of the bad reviews are for non-sushi items). also, they have happy hour between 1-5pm where it's buy one get one free.
author: Betty W.

description: The sashimi was yummy, but the rolls leave much to be desired. But for a neighborhood sushi restaurant, I was pretty happy.
author: Sara D.

description: go about 3 times a week, i actually was just there. i live around the corner.....if u dont go to happy hour you are missing out...great food and pretty girls serving you....I agree with Jaye C, about taking awhile for the bill,but i just started gettin used to it.noones perfect ...that being said they need new music.
author: tim v.

description:
i can't say anythign bad about this place.  the wife and i had edamame, sushi, and udon last night.

The food: fine, but not great. 
Service: excellent
Atmosphere: really clean, sparsely decorated joint.  
Price: really fair for what you get.

i'll be going back because i live 2 blocks away, otherwise it's not really worth trekking to ingleside for....
author: N C.

description: Me and my gf went there since on yelp, they have pretty good review but after we ate there, they are just ok.  the nigiri and sashimi were pretty bad because the fish wasnt cut against the grain and was very stringy while the sashimi is very thin. Service is not bad either. Except that when we are eating, the owners or workers kids are playing with a rc car around our table when we are trying to have our meal and it ran under the table and hit the chair which my gf was sitting on. Even though its not a big deal, it wasn't professional.  But it was pretty clean and good atmosphere.
author: Win S.

description: Wonderful sushi and very affordable. Never busy and great service. Highly recommend!
author: M S.

description:
every time we come here we are pleasantly surprised by 
1. The quality of the food
2. The atmosphere
3. The Friendly wait-staff

Excellent sushi, not gonna lie, its not the best but it's damn good for 4-11 dollars a roll (most deluxe rolls are only $7-10). I recommend the dragon and the volcano rolls, but i haven't gotten to try em all yet!
author: Nitai V.

description:
I moved here in January and have been meaning to try this place for ages.
My husband and I went for the sushi for 2 and it was scrumptious..also love the fact that we get served tea throughout the meal.
Prices very reasonable and service great - looking forward to it becoming a regular haunt
author: karen M.

description: Let's start with the food. If you r a sashimi lover this is not the place for you, the quality is low(that's why the price is low). I order a few nigiri and the fish is just don't taste right and the rice sometimes hard and sometimes too soft, but if you want to save some money and satisfy your craving then this is the place for u. The servers r nice, it would be nicer if the sushi chef says something to the customers when they walk in instead of look at them and say nothing. "that's money into your pocket"
author: uncle m.

description: the food here is waaaay overpriced and the sushi is not that great. the location is great (cuz its close to my house) but the food isnt. if you're a sushi snob like i am,  don't even bother.
author: B B.

description: I have been here twice with my boyfriend and the service and food is great. I always order the bento box. you get to choose  three items from the list (really cheap too $12). i had the salmon, gyoza, and california roll.  the salmon was wonderful. it was tasty and cooked perfectly. i would come back here again.
author: Abby S.

description: this place is ok. i came a couple of times because it was close to my house. the people who work here are nice and friendly. their food is ok and their portion is nice!. i used to order unagi don ( love unagi!) the place is small and clean. i will comeback again just to see if they have something new in the menu.
author: Christian P.

description: I love love lovvvvvve this place. I go once a week at least. Their sushi is the best I have ever had. Their miso soup and gyoza are equally good. This is the only place I've found whose gyoza aren't burnt or soup isn't gross. This place is so good and cheap!!! I highly recommend it.
author: Jamie W.

description: I live a block away from Yama and go there on a regular basis for take out.  At first I thought it was incredibly out of place for a sushi restaurant to open on a block that seems rather shady and I doubted the quality of the sushi.  I expected to find some sushi like that express crap you'd find in the financial district.  I always get either a spider/dragon/caterpillar roll and a Salmon Teriyaki and it's very filling.  Prices are pretty high, but for a sushi place one block away from home, I don't really care.
author: kenny w.

description: Decent food. I didn't really enjoy my beef teriyaki.. the meat was chewy. Wonderful service. But not in the best neighborhood. Would return just because of the friendly staff
author: lee d.

description: Because of its proximity to our house, my wife and I frequently order food from Yama Sushi.  Good food, good prices, friendly staff.  I feel like I can't really give this place 5 stars though, since as a (relative) sushi neophyte I don't have much experience on which to base a comparison.
author: Jason V.
